tmMPlg3Rzz-3ove0WZ9dzQ.text: I alway visit this spot when I'm in Charlotte. This is my go to place when I feel like comfort food. It has a really chill laid back feel that anyone that comes in will be welcomed. I always get the chicken and rice with queso. I also pair it with with cornbread stuffing and green beans. The cornbread stuff is very savory but it's a little heavy on the salt for me. The green beans aren't anything special. I wish they would give them a little love tho. I think they are out of a can from the looks and taste,but hey they are known for the roasted chicken so you know.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roasted chicken with rice and famous cheese queso.

jKqMtNTQhrQwU0ZEuyM1MA.text: It's been 15 years or so since the last time I ate here; i.e., pre-marriage, children, etc. However, it was a bit nostalgic to come back with wife and family in tow. While the vibe is a bit different, they have given the building a facelift and added a brew pub, the food taste and quality is just as I remember. Reasonably priced family food is not always easily found, so I was pleased. I don't know the next time I'll be back, but would definitely come around again the next time I'm in the area.

g4FnWY3YDjQGmYT8DWBe8Q.text: The food is good. Service was terrible. We put in a huge order for our company. They did not have it ready and then the guy was extremely rude to us even though we put the order in an hour before it was to be picked up. When people are spending a lot of money at your restaurant you should not call the business and be rude about it when you mess up. Good restaurant. Obviously can't handle big orders.... We will be ordering catering from other places next time. Sad I had to change my 5 star review due to the way I and others here were treated.

2Vu9j7WOSHnySdDIBaRLAQ.text: Best place yet I have been in Charlotte!!!  Great Beer selection ! ( Wooden Robot)- and me...I give you 10 stars in being able to figure out how the hell to actually cook vegetarian side dishes that are really vegetarian!!  Guess what no one else can figure it out!  Bland Bland bullsht! Your food was awesome and I as a long time vegetarian so appreciated actually trusting that your side dishes were vegetarian!  I had the 4 sides and cornbread.  Squash casserole was dynamite and had beans, corn and greens!  Yum you guys!!! Thanks for being vegetarian respectable! I know my meat eating relatives loved the other food too!

JvJ7wlZprL57Um44KWZqKw.text: Loved my experience here! The chicken was delicious. They catered to my indecisiveness and I was able to get half white meat/half dark. With a double order of veggies, I was able to find a paleo-friendly meal at a great price!   I went on Thursday and they had good wine specials and an awesome trivia concept called "Not your Boyfriends Trivia." All questions were geared towards females and it was so entertaining!   Chicken. Wine. Trivia. I don't think I could ask for anything better!

DtzDSWurPetqldb_NnG0jw.text: I was not blown away with the food at the Roasting Company when I went like many people were it seems. I ordered the chicken and black beans con queso, and it was good but nothing memorable. The chicken was pretty moist and had decent flavor, and was very good with the Tico sauce- which I'll admit is excellent! The black beans and rice were pretty bland and the queso was average as well. I also got a side of green beans that was okay and macaroni salad which was very good. Overall, I'd recommend the mac salad and the tico sauce on chicken but not much else stood out.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and black bean con queso combo

_4GcmWIX7TvJcayUSshOGA.text: I used to think more highly of the Roasting Company but a few recent visits left me wanting a little bit more flavor or tenderness with my chicken.  Perhaps my tastes have changed in my old age.  Anything is possible.  Anyway, RC excels in their side items with many having a southern twist to them including mashed sweet potatoes, collards, etc.  For meals they feature tex mex items like burritos and then they also have rotisserie chicken.    They have a small salsa bar and a few sauces on the table.,  The hot sauce has a nice smokey flavor to it and goes well with anything you put it on.  The restaurant can get very busy at peak times so you may have to wait until at table is cleared before you sit down.

x8fjk29ZTfAV1bc0vul-qA.text: Roasting Company has the best chicken around! They are quick and the food is fantastic! We've lived in Charlotte for 6 years now and tried Roasting company once and have been back monthly ever since! They have done alot of renovations to their store the past year or so and it's great! the store looks much better and there is more room to sit. I highly recommend Roasting Company!!

oTRgT80Fu0PlHzK2v-snlQ.text: Ventured to the Roasting Company after being guided here by coworkers.  Atmosphere - Dive-y, old, been here forever feel, busy, rickety table & chairs, diner-esque.  Food - opted for the chicken & black bean combo platter w/ sweet potato mash and corn bread.  The meal is basically pulled chicken on a bed of rice that is drizzled w/ a, black in color, barbeque soy tasting sauce called Jaco sauce.  The flavor was okay but too salty soy for my liking.  The sweet potato mash was dark in color and kind of bland in taste.  The corn bread was just okay.  Service - Yep, at ordering you kind of feel obligated/ guilt-ed into tipping when basically you do all the work w/ the exception of clearing the table.  I would rather leave cash for the table cleaners on the table and not tip on the credit card receipt.  That way I know that they would truly get the tip.     Overall - It was just okay...nothing great.  I may give them another try if in the area but I would not go out of my way to stop here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken &amp; Rice platter w/ Black Beans, Sweet Potato Mash, and Cornbread

qbeiqZNBBVbVbjEvqvjytA.text: I've been to this place about 3 times at different times of the day..... They're consistently on point! I sat beside I guy that says he's been going for over 20 years!! Prices are very affordable and they pack the plates!! Check it out don't be lame

sim6LZIjDC9qaQfDjl5Ktw.text: My girls and I were out and about on the  town today and decided to have a pre Mother's day lunch. We pulled up the Yelp app and the Roasting Company came up. Not sure what we were getting into, but we were ready for the challenge. As we drove up we noticed that the restaurant was pretty laid back and inviting. In this place you are the waitress. You put in your order at the window and wait for your name to be called for pick up. It's was almost like my mom calling me to dinner. All utensils napkins and drinks were at your disposal. This was odd, but I found it pretty cool and different. The food was great and piping hot. I ordered the 1/4 roasted chicken which was delicious. The pasta and cheese salad was the bomb! The greens were a little to tart for my taste ( just a table spoon or two of sugar will cut the bitterness) other wise my lunch was great. My daughter's  had the chicken and rice with black beans. They absolutely loved it. They had a variety of sides which consisted of yams, cornbread dressing, bake beans and potato salad. All were good, however the cornbread dressing was to sweet. Regardless, we had a ball and I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

cb42g1Bolwua44CRcCJ63A.text: This place was a lifesaver! We were stuck overnight in Charlotte due to a missed connection (not our fault!) and needed food really late! The Roasting Company came to our rescue with a closing time of 2 am and with very delicious food! Delicious roasted chicken and great sides. I would not go far as to say that the sides are vegetables (or at least healthy ones) but they were so so so good! Yum! It took quite a bit of restraint not to order another quarter rotisserie chicken and I totally would have if I hadn't eaten all of the sweet potato and cinnamon apple sides!! It's so good!

z91-O3zIToRPw-6YxNFYvg.text: Finally came back during peak lunch time instead of 3 pm and figured it out.  I usually headed straight to the bar which is full-service, but for everyone else it is counter service.  All the more reason to sit at the bar!

Y9tmwXBHSPV--ADy5hhrKg.text: I'm giving them three stars based on service, and what my fiends had. I unfortunately got the rotisserie chicken sandwich. In their defense I should've paid better attention to the description..it was shredded chicken with "jaco" sauce (which is BBQ sauce). It was what they said it would be..just sounded way better on the menu. But bad idea for a sandwich. The bottom bun was so soggy & heavy that it literally fell apart when I attempted to pick it up. It was at best an ok sandwich. The collard greens were meh, I've had WAY better. However my friends got a chicken wrap that looked ridiculous, and they said it was. So I'd give the food another chance.   The bar service was on time! We went to see one of our favorite local bands play, WICKED POWERS! Luckily for us they had $3 natty green drafts..yes please! The bartenders were quick & knowledgable. They only serve local on draft, not sure about bottled.

VwpziQjtadNvjPIYFMPmSQ.text: My husband and I love The Roasting Company.  The food is fantastic, fast, and always served with a smile.  We always sit at the bar because of the hospitality Jake and Danielle give.  They deliver consistent great service that we can count on.  The beer selection is great too.  Jake, the bar manager, always gets in great beers like those from Wooden Robot and Wicked Weed, that are just not found everywhere in Charlotte.  In fact, I don't know that you can get Wooden Robot but 2 places outside of the brewery.   The Roasting Company is perfect comfort food with a casual vibe and we always feel right at home.  Love this place!

GMoVTClEpG48o8c4hQ7YGw.text: I was staying at the Doubletree next to the South Park Mall with no feeding options other than typical suburban chains....a wasteland as far as I was concerned. I decided to wander through the neighborhoods looking for something a little more local and a little less factoryized.  I found it here.  The best I can say is The Roasting Company exceeded all my expectations. I like that they specialize in one thing (chicken) and they do it well. My 1/4 dark was moist and flavorful and the two sides were well worth trying.  I always try to sample New To Me dishes so I tried the Squash Casserole and Smoked Cheese Salad. I was happy with both. The casserole was helped out by the slight addition of hot sauce (Lisorno?) and the salad was just fine the way it was.  For southern-style grub this is a good as I've had and would definitely come back again.  Oh, by the way, my entire lunch including drink was under $10. A very good value.

zSRRF9CaRNsNLo320XCCAg.text: I didn't know what to expect from this place since I don't eat meat but this place exceeded my vegetarian taste buds! I ordered the vegetarian combo minus the cheese! It was absolutely delicious instead if the corn bread I got the tortillas! It also comes with two sides I got the stir fry veggies with the collard greens and turned my lunch into a southwest combo! The only thing that through me off at this place is I didn't know if I should sit and order good or order at the register. When you go here order at the register! This is a chilled laid back place to grab a good bite when your on a budget!

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Collard greens!
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Black beans and rice with stir fry veggies!

R9YWItV3PSOj9LCToOd_Gg.text: I had the chicken salad sandwich and it was good but could have used a little punch of some sort. However, I thought their wings were a touch better.  On the wings, they were a bit light on the sauce and didn't fully understand what I meant by crispy I guess. I ordered them with Hot Buffalo sauce and got the nuclear on the side since several of us were eating them. The nuclear is fairly hot but on my scale not nuclear. Very meaty wings.

t8Q_MZcPXp8PoneNJBYnaQ.text: I loooove this place. I always have a great time. The staff are absolutely great! The food is amazing! My friends and I love coming here for food or just to hang out. Either way.....great!!!

CtP-NpYHrxOn6zRPyFET5A.text: When I was first invited to eat at The Roasting Company with friends, I hadn't heard of it before, but I was up for it.  When we got there, I thought, "Are you kidding?  It looks like a dive."  Once we entered, though, you could immediately tell that it wasn't a dive.  It just has the poor luck of being in what appears to be an old small strip mall.    It's a good idea to pick up one of the menus as you walk in (and before you step up to the ordering counter) because there's a lot to choose from!  Their speciality is rotisserie chicken with a Mexican or Tex-Mex flair.  My favorite dish is the chicken and black bean combo con queso.  Why?  It's chicken, two sides/veggies, black beans, and cheese.  YUM.  Top that with one of their hot sauces and I've got a double YUM.  Now comes the difficult part:  deciding which two side items from the list of about 15.    Garlic or mashed potatoes?  Spinach?  White bean au gratin?  Baked apples?  AARGH.  I can't decide!  They all sound so good.  I've tried several over different visits and I can tell you that they're ALL good.  That makes it even tougher to decide.   The dining room is pretty casual and not overly themed, but i like the high-backed booths for some privacy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

F0-X_GaQSClqqoXwWn2osQ.text: My first and last visit at the Roasting company was a terrible experience.  called in a take out order Sunday 9/24, around 5PM, and was told it would be ready in 45 minutes.  Arrived to pay and pick it up 55 minutes later, and the order was NOT ready. Waited for 10 additional minutes there and it still was NOT ready. The girl at the cash register didnt seem to be bothered with this at all, like it was normal.   Several other customer hanging around waiting were grumbling about how long it was taking to get their food.  Got refund and went to Midwood Smokehouse 3 blocks away and was out the door with my food in 10 minutes.  Lack of interest and concern by the staff was obvious.

MPOQZ_H53HQAPuHuKkgL-A.text: I'm an in-and-outter here (usually food to go).  However, I've sat at the bar a few times and the service, along with the food, could not be better for what they're trying to do.  I love rotisserie chicken and their's has always been juicy, hot, and fresh.  And the Tico sauce makes it even better, too!  Let's just say I'm a fan.

XgEhYLq0-EU94stwUsQ_TA.text: Love love love this place. Never disappoints. Food is served fast, hot and fresh. I have never had a bad experience at The Roasting Co.

w8-HwbxI-Upbh-0XldiT3A.text: My buffalo chicken wrap was amazing and affordable. The bartender was very helpful and nice. Definitely want to try more off the menu

F7ZRF7ZXyyoDnG8NgnB_HA.text: Had a yummy, hearty dinner here last night.  The chicken and rice was recommended by the cashier, with a hearty sample. The chicken was so tender, it fell apart with a spoon! The jaco sauce was wowzers good!  I had a squash casserole which was topped and baked with breadcrumbs and was delish, however I didn't care too much for the basil green bens, that were mushy and tasted out of a can.  The service is counter order and self service, but they didn't have any trays, which made carrying dishes and drinks, and grabbing utensils a treacherous trip from the open kitchen counter to the table.   Will look forward to returning and trying out other dishes!

4QLftxch2kcVYG-yAersNA.text: I'm a slacker for not writing these guys a review, did not realize I had not done so already!  Anyways, our office treated us to lunch here and it was fabulous as always!  I have had the pot pie - which is a special on Wednesday or Thursday, I think??  It had great flavor and it is HUGE!  I think it took me 3 days to finish.  My go to meal though has turned into the chicken on rice with con queso, which is what I had today.  The chicken has great flavor and of course so does the con queso.  My favorite sides are the squash casserole and the baked apples.  Large portions create for multiple lunches or sharing!  One other one that I have tried is the chicken and queso wrap - I think it is called this?  You are better off just getting the chicken with rice and queso, it is the same stuff stuffed in a wrap and it is huge - too much to hold in you hand and it falls apart.  Not sure about the other wraps, but to me, just avoid the wraps and ask for tortillas on the side of your meal to make your own small wrap.  Always have had great fast service and great food.  Love this place!

j5cpqkRv-obcP7TjY62JWQ.text: Great southern cooking with a hint of spice. My soon devoured the drumsticks in one bite. Chill atmosphere with no frills but lots of flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

98xFiCOZ3k8uPj9ANrIjTA.text: I love the big salads and the chicken and some of the vegetables. Great place to eat when you can't decide what you want to eat.  There is a separate bar area where you can order a drink but you better be willing to wait. The bartender has totally ignored me on two visits. I had to get my son to order my drink! Not sure whats up with the bar area but that is the reason for only 3 stars.

Ec7X6cSKJfqnq10bKN29ig.text: I love the Roasting Company. They fairly recently upgraded the atmosphere and added a bar but the food remains unchanged. Great comfort food.  The 1/4 Chicken and two veggies is a favorite of mine. The squash casserole and cornbread stuffing are both awesome but you cant go wrong with any of their sides including collards, baked beans and more.  My only complain is that they only serve their mac and cheese on Saturdays.

Vc7iXHEWuG7NU_wCZ2fxZg.text: Awesome rotisserie chicken and sides. My fave is the squash casserole. No matter how many people rave about the jaco sauce and how many times I've tried to like it, I just can't. It's super overpowering and sweet and when it came with my chicken and rice dish, it felt like the whole dish was drenched in it, making it more like a soup.  That aside, everything else I've had has been awesome.

PFts0XBJooEcCTXTGRJomA.text: This spot was recommended by Marissa at the hotel for a really good gluten free home cooked meal and microbrews. And yes, several delicious gluten free beer options including an IPA (very rare). It was better than expected or hoped for and the staff was wonderful! We had a really wonderful, fairly priced gluten free meal and microbrew!

bXdMGhIxWCBGPopvgKCflw.text: This place is a gem in Charlotte. My friends are always raving about the chicken here and it does not disappoint.   Friendly service and a huge selection of delicious dishes will have you coming back for more. Chicken is a favorite here but you really cannot go wrong, everything on the menu is fantastic. Wednesday's are chicken pot pie days so you will definitely want to come then! It takes a bit longer to get the chicken pie as they are baked on demand and they may run out before the end of the night.  I gave this place 4/5 solely based on the food pick up on busy nights, the wait is long and it gets confusing on whose order is what. If they could streamline that process this place would be spot on!

RrxZ_5K2ZUUvRyeRpO5RTQ.text: I see the cause for the mixed reviews. Hard to get bar service when there's no empty seats at the bar. I appreciate how after 10 minutes of sitting there no one at least came over. Even though I didn't get to see the manager I see all the reviews about the poor management. First time here, and the last. Get yourself a staff that cares.

f3nNNp1420m4Cw-q4yLffA.text: I'll start by saying I frown on animal abuse, but I'd be lyin' if I said I wasn't glad someone killed all those chickens and let Roasting Company cook 'em up for me. This is the best restaurant under $20 in the city. I want an iv of Tico Sauce hooked up to me. Will it kill me? Probably. Don't care though.   Overall: A+

SVhoJiFlUDG8XW_O1Lb7aA.text: Since I was a little kid, this has been the best chicken I've ever tasted. And the roasted potatoes, chicken tacos and of course the tico sauce are A1...

2obAoKPnCcr10ZjL0jVC3w.text: Can I do 3.5? Not quite worthy of 4 stars, but close. Very unimpressive when you walk in, but you can't always judge the quality of the food by the decor. I ordered the Jaco Pork salad, with the jalapeno ranch dressing. I scooped on some of the super spicy Pico de Gallo from the salsa bar too. It was very good, the pork was moist and flavorful. I was pleasantly surprised by how much pork there was in relation to the serving of lettuce. I wasn't impressed with the dressing at all, but the salad was still very good.   My Daughter ordered the cheese quesadilla, with a side of garlicky new potatoes. She loved both, she even finished everything!  My Wife ordered the chicken taco platter, which was also very well received and enjoyed.  I was surprised that they weren't very busy, it was 12:30 on a College Football Saturday. There is no waitress service, you order from a cashier, then they call your name and you go pick up your own meal. Drinks are self serve too.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jaco pork salad with spicy spicy pico de gallo

XuJGh1AK7YCstlZa1Kk_jA.text: The food here is excellent and affordable comfort food, primarily chicken based. It's a laid-back place and a nice change of pace on Montford. It's a no-frills establishment and you'll be served quickly. My favorite dish is the chicken nachos. I definitely recommend heading here if you want a good, tasty, quick meal.

H1PGbHGImoPEwhJ4ZE4GNQ.text: The restaurant is really confusing. The layout is very strange as you order and wait to get your good and then move to the other side to eat. The staff is a bit rude and impersonal. I'm not sure if I'm impressed.

O5vh2UZHdY_VlyEjR8tFCQ.text: Where else can you pick from a full menu that has chicken con queso, rotisserie chicken, and vegetarian dishes at 12am? That would be the Roasting Company. I come here about once a week and the food is to die for. I love the squash casserole and the smoked pasta salad. Haven't had any other sides really because I've fallen in love with those two. But PLEASE get the chicken con queso. It will change your life. For real for real.  Also, if you go around 5 or 6pm, prepare to wait if you don't call in your order. It's not a bad wait, but it's just a lot better to call in. You may hold, but the staff is VERY courteous and they will make sure you're taken care of.  And you get cornbread with every entree.. And cornbread is amazing.  Oh! And the bartender who is regularly there is awesome. Very knowledgable about beer, wine, and the food menu. So grab a drink and chat with him!

K1UCu6X3crRY0iiCN_77sw.text: This is my boyfriend's favorite restaurant in Charlotte hands down.  They have the most amazing rotisserie chicken and their sides are incredible.  I highly recommend the smoked cheese pasta salad, squash casserole, cornbread dressing, or garlicky potatoes.  If you're a vegetarian you can have a great meal by just getting a side plate.  It's always super fast and the atmosphere is nice.  The prices are also great, you can get a huge meal for under $10.  They also have a full service bar where you can order your food if you sit there.  I will also mention they have an incredible chicken pot pie on Wednesdays however to get it you will probably need to get there by noon.  If you go to one restaurant in Charlotte make this your spot!

CHkJl1R6ABzSgcnhq40fRQ.text: It was ok. I had the chicken and dumplings Thursday special. Good flavor, but the dumplings were runny and ruined the entire experience. Would I try it again? Probably not, but I can see some potential. So if you're in the area why not give it a try, you'll probably have a better experience.

7chAOsg_Qlx0ZhkNnQhZ8g.text: Great spot for a quick lunch.The chicken is above average and they have a great variety of sides. I eat here on a regular basis.

_mH9nIBcCnNlqBU8-usJiA.text: Great vegetables, even though baked apples is a fruit. I've tried the chicken and the pork dishes and love them all.

Xfx48T8ZSJvzgJbY5l6xKQ.text: 2nd time... Chicken n rice w. Collars greens GREAT, but the the baked cinnamin apples were AMAZING!!

KEzf86ql-XgAgWCfcNqRxA.text: Man, I have been coming here forever, since I was a youngster, and I have eaten the exact same thing every single time!!!  The two soft tacos platter with a veggie on the side is definitely my main jam.  It's a cheap meal (under $6 as far as I can remember), perfect place for a quick lunch or take-out.  I flood my tacos with their signature "Tico Sauce" and savor every moment of it.  The atmosphere in there is cool, I love the tall booths and dub music.  If you're a vegetarian, they have a really super selection for veggie plates.  The white beans au gratin, squash casserole, black bean salad, smoked cheese & pasta... dare I go on?  It's the kind of place where you order & grab your meal at the counter, so there isn't a waitstaff, but my folks taught me well by always leaving a dollar on the table in appreciation for the busser's hard work.

BY837veRt7BlfqVziNFFtA.text: Always eat the same thing when I go... two chicken tacos w/black beans. First off, the black beans are AMAZING... good flavor, spicey and vegeterian! I cant get enough of them. The tacos are huge, they put a ton of chicken (almost too much) but they are a little dry... I add the mild and medium salsa and sour cream to mine... I can typically only eat 1 and save the other for later. This was my first time for lunch, typically I get dinner and the place was packed, looooong line. If you are not dining in or have time crunch I suggest ordering ahead.

IPK0JpK8cXas0ekEUk1GFw.text: You have to try the squash casserole! Some of the best eatin' Charlotte has to offer!

ASyAVDJlavoWWNTdApK_Uw.text: I cannot get enough of this place!  It's got a pretty diverse menu so everyone will be able to find something they like (if they like chicken that is).    I love that it is NO NONSENSE.  You order your food, they call your name, you pick it up.  The end.  The people who take your order have it down to a science - they are fast yet friendly.  The only exception to the rule is the really tall guy with long hair.  He is the rudest person I've ever met, but he seems to be part of the establishment (although I haven't seen him in a while).    The food: I love their corn bread.  It is amazing.  It's sweet and moist and flavorful.    I usually get the chicken and rice con queso.  Then I add the Tico sauce that's on the table.  I don't know what this stuff is, but it's so good.  It's not hot, but it does have a lot of spice and vinegar.    My favorite sides are the squash casserole and the pineapple casserole (but this is only served occasionally).  The daily sides are listed up on a board above the counter.    Also if you go on Wednesday, it's CHICKEN POT PIE day.  They have an excellent chicken pot pie.  It's huge and could feed at least 2 people (if you're willing to share).    Overall:  If you love chicken, you'll love this place.  They have a great selection.  They even have wings which I've heard were great.

SjlCXhXdM0s1gMHFygOOzA.text: Stopped by for a quick bite and had forgotten how great the good tastes. Hubby had pork and rice, garlicky potato and turnip greens, I had 1/4 chicken, spicy mac n cheese and stir fry veggies.  YUM!  We finished all of it and washed it down with Imperial Beer from Costa Rica which was the first time I had found it in the states.  It's a bit noisy if there are families there, although it did not matter to us once you start eating.

CbhEQxg84gejcqBKHtnx-Q.text: Very good, cheap food.   Lunch (12pm) was crowwwd-ed, no tables and a line out the door, so we ended up getting stuff to go. They have the take-out system down, with little containers lining the salsa bar so you can grab whatever you'd like to pile onto your tacos or whatever.  Interesting variety of flavor here, ranging from tex mex (medium salsa) to cumin-y mexican (jaco). The unsalted heat of the pico was rad. There were even little packets of malt vinegar. Dude.  The collards were the highlight for me. Deeply smoky, bitter and tart, and just salty enough. Wolfed 'em down. Squash casserole was meh, but other sides, and the 3 pound veggie wrap, were all delicious and unique.  I whine about this area being an annoying drive from where we live, but there's so much awesomeness here, might be time to park an RV somewhere clandestine and have a weekend pad in this cool little area of "south park". Or just quit whining and deal.

-vjU-cqmygyvemDmsIHiwQ.text: Meh...  It wasn't bad or good.  I ventured here since it is close to my place of work, and I didn't feel like driving to my favorite Rotisserie Chicken restaurant in Dilworth (which also gets great reviews).  The Jaco sauce was the best part of the meal in my opinion.  Everything else was just OK.    Next time I won't be so lazy and just drive to where my taste buds lead me.  I would eat there again in a pinch, but it wouldn't be my first choice.

Irrdzjo995obxQK_yY01Tg.text: The food here is good, but wasn't exactly what I was expecting. Everything was was good quality and well prepared (and fast!) and the price was very reasonable. My wife and I both ordered the 1/4 rotisserie chicken (white) which came with cornbread and two sides. I got the baked beans and the special: spicy mac & cheese. The first thing I tried was the cornbread, and found it had jalapenos and whole kernels of corn baked in. I know some people really like the whole corn in the cornbread thing, but I'd rather keep my breads and vegetables separate. Next up was the spicy mac & cheese. I love mac & cheese, and I've become a big fan of having a bit of hot sauce added to give it some kick, so I was really excited about this. It certainly had the spicy; it had lots of jalapenos mixed in and was quite hot. What it was lacking was the cheese. There was no creaminess to it at all. The baked beans, however, were very good. They also had jalapenos mixed in (are you sensing a theme here?), but only had a subtle kick which was balanced with a slightly sweet tangy sauce. As for the chicken, the flavor was excellent but most of the breast was pretty dry. The wing, on the other hand, was quite juicy. If you're looking for really moist chicken you might have better luck with the dark meat. There were no jalapenos in the chicken.

ofgMGWs9WTDRi3eEYEonqA.text: The roasting company is great, one of my favorite local spots for dining in or take out.

o3Vyo5VjZ_N7hf6UpQvjFA.text: We absolutely loved this place. The chicken and black bean con queso is to die for. We enjoyed it so much we went back the next day to try something different. The quality of the chicken is some of the best I've seen. Can't wait to go back to Charlotte to eat there again.

ny8Z7J176d17uMMgmyJQHw.text: Most native Charlotteans know about this hidden little gem of a place... they have wonderful rostissere chicken, flavorful black beans and great cornbread. They also have good chicken and dumplings which may not be on the regular menu but are sometimes the special of the day.  Love this place!

1Q9-veTwtkbommUUHlipeg.text: Roasting Company is pretty good. Good value for the amount of food you get. I usually get the 1/4th chicken and it comes with cornbread and two sides. Cinnamon apples are a must.  Guy at the register is a bit eccentric and makes you feel slightly uncomfortable, but he is extremely nice and on point.

id_Q-ecHOXvkvEIyh4eQPw.text: Will never go again. Several sides non edible.  When I went up to ask for the cornbread which was supposed to be with the meal, the guy behind the counter practically threw them at me,  plopping them into a bowl and pushing them at me. Atmosphere is only good if you have crying babies and young kids because that's what was there and noise echoes throughout the place

V2zlxuh941sWjuZAZKepfA.text: Our family gathered here for dinner last night.  It was quickly served and delicious food.  The chicken was great and the pulled boston pork my husband tried was tasty!

POrvdB6enAXHnxWonxhxyQ.text: The food here needs more seasoning.  Sure the chicken and pork are roasted until it shreds with a fork, but that doesn't compensate for the lack of taste. I'm not a fan of their Jaco sauce which is probably why I'm not a fan.  But their sides are also pretty tasteless too.   Try it; you might like it...if you're into bland(er) food.

hXNWrDWa1xIZM7Br0g-DwQ.text: When I worked in this area, I used to eat lunch here once every week. They have a good variety of roased chicken dishes and the food comes with some delicious spicy cornbread muffins. The chicken is delicious but don't sleep on the jaco pork which has a hard to describe BBQ-like sauce. I think the pork stands up to it better than chicken could. Then kick it up with some of their hot sauce.   The sides are also quite good. I usually stick with the collards but there's plenty to choose from. I usually get my grub on for around $7. Man, talking about it makes me wish I still worked near there.

xAhDyZn7HDpFaujnchdPSA.text: I wish I liked their food a little more, especially after reading all the awesome reviews of this place.  I got the chicken with rice, queso, and black beans with a side of sweet potato fries and a cornbread muffin.  It just wasn't packed with flavor the way I was expecting it to be.  The chicken part was kind of bland and definitely needed to be spiced up a bit.  Don't order their sweet potato fries if you're expecting them to be drizzled with a sweet or honey glaze.  I actually prefer mine salty but the pepper they add to their fries really threw me off.  The cornbread muffin wasn't too bad but it didn't stand up to my high cornbread standards.  I liked that the food came out pretty fast.  I also enjoyed the casual dining area. I was a little confused when we were finished eating because I had no idea what to do with my plate and glass.  This place doesn't have servers that come to the table so I was searching for a trash can to throw my stuff away but didn't see one.  We saw some other people leave before us that just left their used plates on the table so we followed suit.  I might come back to try out a different entree.  Hopefully this place has really good food and I just chose the wrong menu items.

7GyW4hZ8TcGW-l3AiOMd5Q.text: The Roasting Co. is my idea of what perfection is in a restaurant...why???  - Consistent, Supremely Delicious Food - Great Prices - Unpretentious, Laid Back Atmosphere - Great Central Location for Most of the Town - Fast, Friendly Service  When I lived in Charlotte, this place was a staple for me.  I've never had a bad...anything here.    The rotisserie chicken goes w/o saying, it's excellent and a natural first choice for the less adventurous.  The Jaco (say, HA-ko) pork anything is the tastiest, most tender pig you'll find this side of Eastern NC 'cue.  You can't go wrong w/the Tacos, Sandwiches, and the Black Bean con Queso Combos (Pork or Chicken).    Cooking meat well is relatively easy to do...to make one crave vegetables...is not.  You can go here just for the vegetable options alone and be more than satisfied.  I've almost consumed the entire spectrum here except the coleslaw and it's all good.  The 'tops' are the Basil Green Beans, Herbed Rice, and Mashed Sweet Potatoes.  The Cinnamon Apples can be savored as a desert in itself!  The Stir Fry veggies would be the only mediocre item on the menu I've had, but even they're still tasty.    Bottom Line...Go...now...

NCFaSlhf_HORa6XEUJca0w.text: I ordered wings and veggies to go.  They were fast and ready when I got there.  The wings are very good, big and meaty.  The evil wings (Hotter than regular wings) were great, but I was expecting hotter.   I will go back =)

GXiGh5VJZyCnAo_-6yHXbg.text: I've been to the Roasting Company on numerous occasions; that being said, feel free to take this review for what it's worth.  The Roasting Company just does not have the best food.  My co-worker loves this place, so we go at least once every two weeks.  I on the other hand am not a huge fan of their menu and how they prepare their foods.  At this place, you order your food at the counter.  Once your meal is ready (under three minutes in my experience), your name is called to pick up your plate.  One can opt to eat either inside or outside on their patio.  There are no trash cans; I leave my food on my table when I'm done...but I'm not waited on by anyone.  Am I expected to leave a tip...?  I have ordered a number of sandwiches and wraps from The Roasting Company.  The presentation of the entrees could not be better, however the quality and taste are negligible.  If you order a sandwich or wrap with any sort of sauce on it, you'll find that they include so much of it that your sandwich just falls apart and you make one hell of a mess.  Even on a sandwich without sauce, the chicken is so juicy to the point that the bread will act as a sponge and absorb all of it.  Nothing irks me more than soggy bread.  As for the taste, there is nothing special about their menu; you could make the same items at home (and likely not force yourself to contend with all the sog!).  I give them two stars for their killer sweet potato fries, despite the fact that they only make them on days of their choosing.

ot9-gwHUS4ElLwahHMcYCA.text: This is one of those "regular" places for me. I make a 10 mile, one-way, drive to enjoy the Jaco Pork on Rice with squash casserole, and collard greens. The chicken is what they are known for and I enjoy that too. The portions are good, the price is right, the atmosphere is relaxed. You can't go wrong here for a good meal.

livIq6-S6KVu_UMo8_wJ8g.text: Squash casserole is the best! Love the chicken too! My new favorite fast food that doesn't taste fast :) try them !

R7joL2gGi3tqX6-1N705yg.text: There have been some other eateries popping up right down the street on Montord, but this remains a gem. As someone who tries to eat semi-healthy and likes variety with my meal, this is the ideal place. And it's pretty affordable, in the $8-$10 range.  The main event here is chicken, with a bit of a latin twist. You can go the traditional Southern route with both how you get your rotisserie and the sides you choose. I like a little flavor kick, so I went with the Chicken and Black Bean combo, served over rice with that tangy jaco sauce. If you want to splurge calorically a bit, you can get the same thing with queso.  You can go sandwich style, or go for the platter. The platter is a great value, as it comes with cornbread and your choice of endless sides. You can sub in some tortillas if you want to tilt your meal further to the South.  There are many tasty sides, including mac and cheese, greens and many other staples. I went with the garlicky new potatoes and the special stir fry mix of vegetables, which included broccoli and squash. The veggies were fresh, and the potatoes were creamy. It will probably take a long time before you can try out every side here, but I really don't think you can wrong with any combo.  I like the fact that you order up front, and they yell out your name when it's ready, and be warned, the food gets ready fast. The only question with seating was the lighting, but then again, I think we kind of picked a bad spot and could have moved to a more open area. The soft drinks are only $1.25, and it's easy access for refills of soda. As someone who loves to experiment with sauces, I really dig the fresh salsa bar. That pico de gallo is spicy and excellent.  Overall, this is a great place. It always seems to be packed, so come during the slightly off-peak dining hours so you can order, find yourself a seat and be served quickly. As someone who lives in the 'hood, I look forward to many happy returns.

7xbxwoOI0hw7rmDdF7YyVQ.text: Ate here yesterday with a co-worker for the first time in a while, and realized I had never reviewed it!  I REALLY like this place. Can't say much that hasn't already been said, the reviews speak for themselves. Great rotisserie chicken. I love the jaco pork, especially the tacos.  Cool little salsa bar.....great prices. Yea, i'll be back for sure.

g17pp6zgHTuk_A4Zou0iLg.text: The speed in which they deliver your food is always amazing!   Oh yeah, the food is good too.

BVT6oVQByrDIxluqParUtA.text: So good! Why have I never eaten here before? mashed sweet potatoes and squash casserole, both delicious! chicken with black beans con queso, its like the dish was meant for me! My friend got a chicken sandwich which she loved as well. I will definitely be back.

B6Dh-PtcnpJDXj3GkVey5g.text: Don't  get me wrong - the food here was DELICIOUS - I got the chicken and black bean combo with squash casserole (recommended by my friend Hannah) and lima beans (a special veggie that day).  And the service was fast.    It's just the personalities that I had a problem with.  I hate it when staff at places like to "joke" with you and tell you that they're out of something or can't do it.  See my review for Chicago q on how staff should act.  That's all.   Oh, another good thing is that they had fruit punch in their fountain machine... That was fun too.

KwsguHS4sVfpvf_p2xZG7w.text: How to go from first to worst in six short months.  There once was a time when this place served the best food in the city.  They have a new person working in their kitchen who is single-handedly destroying their business.  I have had to send back every plate of food this creep has prepared.  Today will be the last time I will visit this establishment.  I have made my displeasure known on several occasions - to no avail.  I kept coming back hoping the quality would improve.  I used to look forward to coming to the Roasting Company, now I find myself repulsed - all because of one crappy employee.  If you decide to eat here, I'd advise avoiding anything that is made with rice - unless you enjoy rice swimming in an excessive amount of  yucky, milky, buttery film!  WTF is that junk?  Who trained this idiot?  I'd give ZERO STARS if it was an option.

gnX8GLsrhjuJAAZskZ6yLQ.text: The only reason I give it 4 out of 5 stars is because Henry the bar tender. The food is amazing. I've been here 100 times and never had one bad thing to say about it. But tonight the bar tender Henry was just straight up rude. He threw the menus at is when we sat down. Neglected us as we dined. And even tossed our bills at us when we were closing out. We would have drank more had we not been neglected. Needless to say. Next time I go back. I'll make sure he's not working. Or else o will. It attend. He did have a great taste of music. But a terrible personality. And ruined my experience/night. Thanks a lot Henry. See you never. Hopefully.

mRUwup3JpzSw1rEEeI0AFQ.text: The value here is outstanding.  They have the tastiest chicken and I'm really baffled by some of the reviewer's who didn't like it.  I lived in Charlotte the past three years and ate here frequently.   The squash casserole and buttered spinach are my favorite sides and the cornbread - YUM!

l7ehuj2_naiuyqkg7awyCg.text: I was turned on to the roasting company by a colleague and now I'm addicted.  It's truly as good as it gets.  I always get the quarter chicken and it's better than you'll find almost anywhere.  Apples are wonderful too. Everything is served hot the fresh.  There's a reason there's always a line and parking can be hard to find...this place has chicken covered!

z2U6xbokwyqpdJ9ZnmwG-g.text: Never been disappointed by the food at the roasting company. I would say they use high quality ingredients and it's always super tasty. Prices are reasonable for the quality! We go whenever we're in the SouthPark area.

7agV6Edw3ZWSDDCtibhkDA.text: Everything on the menu sounded delicious and I couldn't decide what to order. I ended up with enough food for five people just for me. Perfectly seasoned food and the portions were enough for left overs. Looking forward to going back.

-GyfqfC3BeoWylHjh87aqg.text: The roasting company is just good... no two ways about it.  It is a mix of Tex Mex, Southern, Jamaican, and everything else.  No real way to classify it.  The chicken tastes kinda like the rotisserie places in Queens, the ones where you buy the entire chicken and take it home.    The chicken is flavorful, the cornbread dressing is a little spicy, the wraps are awesome and the prices are just right.  Great when its cold out an you want to warm up for lunch.  Definitely a hearty meal.  I never care about decor, but if you are into a comfy atmosphere, this place might not be for you.  I could care less, all about food for this big girl.    TIp, the lines are really, really long around lunch time.  If you aren't eating in, call in your order and bypass the line by going to the call ahead counter.  The line goes into the parking lot some days and it can be hard to find a table.

zWLbc3TAXdm7nCcTx_ZuWg.text: I just love this place.  I have been eating here since 1995 and only wish that I lived closer so I could get here a couple of times per week.  I used to work a block away and did just that, but now it is probably once every couple of weeks.  My usual is 1/4 white, apples, and white beans au gratin, but I love the chicken and rice too.  The Roasting Company shows that good food, at a good value, served quickly will always find a happy market and they do a big business.  Nobody comes here for the parking, or the atmosphere--it is the yummy food.

-aO8WBwLfST4-ysIK-lHWA.text: I walked away from the Roasting Company, after my first visit, with a big smile and wallet in tacked.  I had a 1/4 roasted chicken (dark meat) with collards, white bean stew and a cornbread muffin for 6.99 with tax.  The chicken was tasty, although I could see where their white meat may sometimes be a little dry.  The highlight was the white bean stew which is their veggie of the day on Thursday's.  It may be a while before I work up another appetite but when I do you will be able to find me at the Roasting Company.

PXxbpbMOz43IES4_VX5mcA.text: Love this place. Come here every Sunday with coworkers and sit on the patio. Love their patio. Food is good and  service is great.

HKbN247XOy3jJLGAmXoBAA.text: I was entirely disappointed. I've heard such good things.. i had the buffalo chicken wrap with a side of mac n cheese. The buffalo wrap was fairly bland, very liquid-y and a mess. My husband had the chicken plate with rice and both didn't have a lot of flavor. I would recommend 10 times over the place around the corner.. sorry i will not be returning. Although the atmosphere and ppl working there were pleasant.

GvUeiyOqxVr63MjE09yl8g.text: Am I missing something here? I just do not find that their food is very flavorful.   The vibe and decor are pretty cool. We came here to meet some friends for beer specials (which are apparently very reasonable on Fridays) and shared a plate of nachos. Decently sized, but we had to put a lot of cholula and their habanero sauce on the chicken to give it some sort of taste.   Not my favorite, but that's okay since Viva Chicken opened up just a little ways down Park Road.

31kqHqdyLpL-QTNoy-SfEg.text: In the couple of years since I last visited, the Roasting Company has added a "taproom" area where they have table service AND BEER. I had no idea!  The chicken is still absolutely great. Moist and tasty. I'd recommend the chicken and black bean con queso. Or one of the chicken pot pies if they haven't sold out. Add a scoop of salsa (mild, hot or very hot) from their salsa bar.  Other than the beer menu (and spirits too), there is a Coke fountain and urns of sweet/unsweet tea.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Taproom area at The Roasting Company

koEiMJSLj5A37le7U_ft_g.text: Fantastic takeout, the best half roasted chicken in town. The queso is popular but I didn't love it. Definitely try the squash casserole.

PXn3PKvID6oXr_SDv57DAA.text: On a quick trip in Charlotte and RoCo was recommended by friends.  It is on Montford Street with lots of other good looking places.  I wasn't exactly sure of the ordering process when I stepped into the restaurant but quickly figured it out and went to the window on the right.  My buddies suggested I go with the chicken and queso.  I threw in the black beans too for the "queso combo."  For my sides I got the oft-mentioned squash casserole and cole slaw.  The chicken, queso, and black beans was really good.  All of the flavors blended well but you could still taste each individual component.  I actually really liked the slaw too.  It was more tangy than sweet as some cole slaw can be.  I didn't love the squash casserole as much as others have but I thought it was good.  The woman who took my order was very nice.  Don't go in here looking for decor.  These folks focus on the food and do that well.  I look forward to trying more think from RoCo on future visits.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queso combo with slaw and squash casserole

yrxNuP2BAHNAlo4uj4xyZg.text: After a wry glance at each other after a workout, my wife and I decided it wasn't going to be a night we cooked in. I had passed by The Roasting Company a few times and had heard good things offhand, so I figured we would give it a try since it is right around the corner from where I live. Overall we had a great experience, pigged out on some delicious dishes, and enjoyed the laid back atmosphere.  Walking in is a little disorienting, as you have to go to the right and place your order. Almost all the dishes are inspired by their slow roasted rotisserie style chicken, which creates an intoxicating aroma as you pull into the parking lot. We ended up ordering the Chicken con Queso with sides of collards, squash casserole (our favorite!), and garlicky potatoes. In a style reminiscent of the backwoods eastern barbecue places I frequent back home, you wait for them to holler your name, then you smirk at everyone still waiting for their food as you make your way back to your table with your overloaded plate.   We ended up sitting at the bar and getting CCC's baby maker on special for $3.50 (FYI it's much more expensive if you buy it at the brewery). We weren't too terribly hungry so we split the meal, which was a great choice as they don't skimp out on portions. Overall everything was prepared wonderfully and I liked all of the selections we had made. Also for the price, you are getting a pretty good bang for your buck IMO. While the main dish was awesome, the sides stole the show. They always have around 20 sides available, so I look forward to trying some different ones in the future.  Fun Fact - If you aren't sold yet, it is also one of Luke Kuechly's favorite places to eat. He considers it a pre-game ritual to eat there the week before the game, and blames the Atlanta loss on his not dining at The Roasting Company for the first time that season. Not to worry though, The Roasting Company made sure to send him a bottle of their Tico sauce so he could keep the tradition before the Super Bowl. You can read the article in the Charlotte Observer.

gWbd7e29JvxX_cFYfwnXQw.text: I just love this place. So many choices for chicken and my fav is the chicken and rice with tico sauce. Add a side of the tico black beans and you can't go wrong.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

qwh0pX_BQ7sIbBHykFyfMQ.text: This is my go-to lunch place where my office is located.  Their lunch is always fast and fresh.  A plethora of veggies to choose from and fresh rotisserie chicken!  In and out in under 30 min with a fresh and healthy lunch...that's winning in my book.

Z_SfCFCMlZ8uEKr5mg0ipQ.text: You know your meal is gonna be good when you can little smell deliciousness from the parking lot!  We decided to check out Roasting Company last night. It is right around the corner from our neighborhood and I can't believe we have never been here before!! You walk up to the ordering area, order, then wait for them to call your name. They have a seating area and a full bar.   On the recommendations of another Yelpers review (thanks Marco!), we ordered the Chicken and Black Bean con Queso. This came with two sides and we got the collard greens and squash casserole. We also added on a side of potatoes. There were so many yummy sounding sides on the menu that it was hard to choose!   We grabbed a seat at the bar and ordered a beer, while waiting for our food. The Triple C Baby Maker was on special for $3.50, which is an incredible deal! As this is one of my favs, beer wise, the choice was obvious!   The food came out and was definitely plenty for two people! The squash casserole was by far the winner!! The chicken and black beans con queso was a nice portion and consisted of rice, black beans, chicken, a bbq like sauce, and cheese all chopped up.   Definitely want to come back as they have daily specials for main courses and sides....mac n cheese, chicken pot pie, and chicken and dumplings were definitely some of the specials I want to return for!

gu5ieCyY-2C24qgq5da-nQ.text: While planning my trip I was checking out many of my old favorites, some are gone, many are still flourishing like the Roasting Company. I lived in the neighborhood and would eat here regularly like 2-3 times a week. Imagine my surprise to find they had finally opened the place up and added a full bar and doubled the size of the menu, all to the betterment of their devoted customers.  I was all smiles when I saw that my all time favorite "smoked cheese pasta salad" was still featured, I got an extra order to take back to the hotel. The rotisserie chicken is still the star here, crispy on the outside, juicy and luscious in the inside. All the sides are great, there are 18 to choose from, something for everybody. Free refills, that beautiful classic salsa bar, and and endless supply of hot sauce and their special Tico sauce. The service is always fast, the food is consistently great, I never understood why these guys haven't expanded beyond Montford Drive because this business would thrive anywhere. Also a great place to watch a ballgame now since the expansion. Got a really nice vibe now.  BTW, I was amused at some of the negative reviews. Are you people insane? And BTW, occasionally Yelp does listen cause I flagged one review that raved about the food, but gave the restaurant one star because she had to "refill my own tea" so if you see any of your favorite places being abused like this please flag away, you never know.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/4 chicken, smoked cheese and pasta salad.

ChZ8JavtaOS-VyP1xV4PbQ.text: I hadn't been to The Roasting Company (or RoCo as all their signage inside said) in about 12 years, so I was excited to see all the changes after they revamped and added a bar. The fella and I stopped in for dinner on a Wednesday night, and we were a little confused when we first walked in. Yes, there's a big ol' sign right above your head that tells you to order at the counter, but still.  We ventured over to the counter and searched for a menu. The sides and veggies of the day were written on chalkboards, but no menu to be found except for the paper to-go ones. There were two cashiers, and I had to wait for them to finish talking to each other before one finally took my order.   I got the 1/4 rotisserie white meat chicken with rice and black beans, and the fella got chicken with jaco sauce and rice. There was SO much meat on my chicken!! And it was moist and delicious. My rice and beans were pretty tasty, too. I tried the fella's chicken since I had never had jaco sauce, and it was like a sweet, smoky barbecue sauce.   He wanted a drink, so we had to pay for our meal at the food counter, then head over to the bar to buy the drink, which was a little annoying. I think you can eat and drink at the bar to put everything on one check, but there were no seats there when we went. By the time we leave around 7 p.m., the place was hoppin'!   Overall, pretty delicious food, especially on a cold, winter night, but the service was a little iffy for me, so A-OK it is.

4ZuSa7odRsjy4ZqvFWCCBA.text: I came here for dinner since my friend stated that it was good and our food would be ready quickly.   I ordered the chicken on rice con queso with a side of collard greens and garlicky (their term) potatoes.   I was startled when a man screamed out my name.. apparently they do that every time someone's food is ready; if you have a heart condition do not stand near the counter..  The collard greens were good and so were the garlicky potatoes; I fear that the chef is afraid of salt though, as my entire dinner was lacking in overall flavor. There was barely any queso in my chicken on rice platter con queso and that is a major problem. Moreover, my entree was barely warm and the rice tasted rather old.  Service at the register was friendly and inviting, but the man at the counter gave me a bad attitude when I asked for a cup.  Overall, I would not come back to this establishment. The food was alright, the cost was too high for what it was, and the service was not the best.

Re8AllG5zJUr3zxXtfM6uw.text: Great food, and friendly staff. Lots of draft beer options if the food isn't enough for you. Homemade sides and delicious chicken all made on site. Highly recommend

d00B8d4uW6lrD5MO71b9Fw.text: The Roasting Company is delicious which is why it's been around for so long. They offer so many great sides and let you know which items are gluten free!

rkCyFUg0gsyAsUBI5g2EVw.text: This place rocks! First visit this evening and the food was incredible. We had takeout which was packed perfectly for travel. Our selection was a 1/2 Rotisserie Chicken dinner with coleslaw, pasta sald, mashed squash, cornbread stuffing & cornbread. The chicken cooked perfectly juicy with great tasting skin was amazing. All the sides were perfect, but the cornbread stuffing will be coming home every time we eat here. The Staff were so friendly I felt at home. Great location, great food, great people. 5 stars all the way.

LnnsPWD9Dq_dHh210xY2Bg.text: 12 years and still going,  we've loved thus place after being introduced by local friends.   Now we bring new friends here too.   It's changed over the years,  adding a bar,  with lots of local beers on tap.   Just a matter of changing with the customer needs.  Food stays great though and the hot sauces are my husbands favorite (aside from the nuclear wings)  nothing is too hot for him.  My daughter and I love the chicken and black bean combo con queso!   The garlicky new potatoes and stir fry are our sides of choice but they have a pretty assortment to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot sauce picks!  Add a nice kick!

2uPKkQ_A40uIFkl6awXspA.text: Overwhelming smell of bleach as soon as you walk in the door.  No way I could eat with that smell.  I had to turn around and walk out...

ODwWmnTGBmWVrno91LRDJA.text: One of my favorite rotisserie chicken hangouts! The chicken is great, even without the special sauce!  When you walk in you walk up to the counter to order your food. Believe it or not, by the time you get your drinks, utensils...etc, you are being summoned back to the station to get your food!  No time wasted at all!  With the recent changes to the dining room they now have more seating and a great looking bar to hang out at.  You can't leave there without getting the Chicken and cornbread dressing!

KDMNJF50z307S80wr1mHFA.text: I had a layover for about 10 hours in North Carolina and I stop by this little place. What impressed me was the chicken pot pie. Unfortunately they had just ran out of it. I instead got the chicken with rice AND queso. With the corn bread dressing and green beans. They chicken with rice was amazing and so was the corn bread Dressing!!! The green beans not so much. Over all the beer was good and so was the food.

7Kb9X-KSWMDeNVHCSmVdng.text: Eat Drink RoCo! !! Great Food and atmosphere! !! Love it!## The chicken was excellent and the sides Great!!! Our plates where clean!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great Place

YoesPMNQ-iLze7M0Zbq9Ag.text: Pork over rice was very good but next time I will ask for it without the Jaco sauce and use the Tico sauce they provide on each table.   Squash cassarole was the bomb just as others mentioned. I could eat a whole pot of the at stuff!! Cornbread muffin was good also with pieces of corn in it...wish the muffin was bigger.   Wasn't so pleased with the buttery spinach but guess it's a little hard to jazz up spinach...put some Tico sauce on it to make it better.   All in all very good and I will be back to test other stuff!!

aoACquunaccGTEmtSnBY2Q.text: Love this place! It has delicious food made from scratch and the service is fast. I especially love the pork. And they have cider on tap which I favor over beer. I also enjoy the patio on warm days.

cG8sDabpVaiQ1fq9_xXjlg.text: Cool atmosphere & service. Food was not bad, but not the best. Missing flavor profiles majorly! We had the nachos, chicken sandwich & rotisserie plate but the chicken just had no seasoning. The dill potato salad needed salt, and the veggies kinda tasted canned, in my opinion. Cake for dessert actually had flavor but was terribly dry. Probably won't go back.

P5zgj-oM0YkXbn88mJ38QQ.text: Great sides, fast service, and great local beer. There daily specials are so good they usually always sellout- so get there early.  salsa bar is always yummy. This Place is never crowded and offers parking which is nice.  They have a great variety of sides, the squash casserole is my Favorite!

hr9HkrMvqg4Es4AVXX4zTg.text: Love the atmosphere. Casual but cool, clean and up to date. Great for families or groups. My daughter and I shared the 10 wings which was just enough for our lite appetites. My husband had the marinated grilled chicken breast sandwich. It came with mayo, cheese, lettuce and tomato. He had the squash casserole for his side. He described it as good. My 9 year old son had the chicken taco kids meal with a side of chips and queso dip. The taco would have been enough for him. There was enough chips and queso that we all had a share and still had some to bring with us.

1rrOGm3dbuKQ1KsXVQIxzA.text: Great great great. The chicken is pretty good but these sides are killer! The smoked cheese pasta, the squash casserole, white beans au gratin, cornbread dressing... The cornbread is steamy & moist and bad yummy little nuggets or sweet corn throughout. This place is a Charlotte gem.

anr3NrYEaxSFaUI41GC1fg.text: Outstanding lunch. Multiple options, quick, and a killer salsa bar.   The nightlife is great as well. They have the best local draught beer bar in Charlotte.   This is probably my favorite place in Charlotte. If you're not a regular, become one.

vYXzQoNZoLR7cILPoF-gQQ.text: I heard a lot of hype on this chicken place and was excited to try it and when we got their the casual and fun feeling was nice, the menu looked great...but the roast chicken just didn't have any flavor/seasoning/taste under the skin!  I was disappointed in the lack of flavor to the chicken meat itself.  Also the sides were hit or miss, some were good, some  were too salty or too sweet.  I'll pass on this place...I like Viva Chicken better...I don't need the bar atmosphere as much as I need good tasty food!

p1898W1kPO3ObuHOdSfw7g.text: Always a great meal. I'm not a slaw person but theirs is the best. Kitchen stays open till 2am!!!!! Yay. I tasted the pineapple casserole.....omg. Divine delicious confusion on the taste buds.

8S3BNJ6Qbcrj9FGqISBk5Q.text: What can I say other than this place is a solid, cheap option with late night food in the Montford area.  Oh! I know what else: the chicken will blow your face off. I don't know what they do to it and the sauce, but it rocks harder than Axel Rose high on an ounce of cocaine with 5,000 ten-foot-tall speakers and a subwoofer that runs on plutonium. It's basically a mix of teriyaki and barbeque sauce that you can slather on some pulled chicken and put on a sandwich or serve over rice (Central American style).  There's also beer galore. A few unique ones are on the list, like the locally-produced and hilariously-dubbed Babymaker IPA. Don't get me wrong: we're not talking World of Beer here. But, the list is still substantial and the prices are good: about $5 per sling of a glass of malty bread.  Service by a younger-looking server was attentive and knowledgeable. That matters to me and is a big reason I went with a five star review.  Atmosphere is chill, not really comfortable. But, it's a fun place, so who the fuck cares.  Bottom line, check it out. It is tops.

Ky64aCc0nN1EijffEK7s-w.text: This place is so good it made me rethink leaving the restaurant industry. I've had the chicken pot pie (wed special) a half chicken and the squash casserole. Very delicious indeed!

fMj0AQd6uzE45IwkNsW2kQ.text: Roasting Co. is pretty good and a very casual setup. It's along the lines of Boston Market; Roasting Co is a step above BM. I will be going there again to try other dishes on the menu. The garlicky potatoes were good. Reasonably priced food and very similar to Boston Market but more like a bar. They are open until 2am so if you are ever bar hopping on Montford it's worth a stop in.

Vf3veBSSnfu33G800kxMWg.text: Vegetarian plate with rice and beans was yummy. If you don't eat meat - there are still options. Plenty of sides if you're okay just doing a sides plate.  Boyfriend got a chicken plate and said the chicken was good and cooked well.  Good portion of food for the price.

bPZnrL5mQ9XD1BKYKAxrfA.text: I didn't know what to expect with this place as the inside is a little run down and what not. I thought the chicken was awesome. I had a side salad which wasn't worth getting and enjoyed potato salad. I thought the price was very cheap for the amount of food you got. I would come here again.

18Y1_avBwBLx7K_H0vzBXw.text: One of my favorite places in Charlotte. There is nothing fancy about it but I get good food every single time. One of my favorite items is the Chicken and Rice con Queso.  But, the thing that I will always order no matter what else they are offering is the Squash Casserole as a side. Good grief it's amazing!  This is great for lunch during the work week or after church. It is usually pretty quick even during busy parts of the day.  I need to try more things on the menu but no one I've talked to has ordered anything there and not declared their need to come back as soon as possible. It is sort of tucked away on Montford so I too often forget about it. But this review helped me decide where I'm going for lunch today!

88zemvbe2aCH9A8r2gWydQ.text: Just as it says on the back of the menu, this restaurant food is both nutritious and affordable. What a great concept! But I would add one more thing and say "nutritious", "affordable" and "yummo!"   I had CHICKEN & BLACK BEAN COMBO W/1 VEGGIE & CORNBREAD and I chose from so many selections "Basil Green Beans" as 1 veggie. I also had a Coke. All under $10.   This is a great place for a quick but tasty lunch. I loved the Costa Rican green chili sauce too!

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sky is so blue!
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Entrance
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken &amp; Black Bean Combo w/ 1 Veggie &amp; Cornbread

k9Tr3H_RX0mu4MhvKRHFcg.text: You have to go on Tuesday and you have to go early in the afternoon - the special of the day only offered on Tuesday is the quintessential friend buffalo chicken sandwich - arguably the best I've ever had. From the bun to the lightly breaded chicken to what I would say is the definitive buffalo sauce. It's all there. Downside is that hey usually sell out by 2 pm.

FRpHqNpkTtCYb4PKYtEXkw.text: The food is delicious. I've had the Monterey Chicken Wrap several times, and it never disappoints. I would give it five stars, if the gentlemen behind the counter tonight would have not talked crap about me not tipping on my takeout order. Just like most of the world, I don't tip on takeout orders unless they are delivered or overly complicated. Furthermore, it's rude to complain within an earshot of your customers. Just sayin'

QhKUxdMsOqSUbaH0kZILVA.text: I enjoyed the food I had the cinnamon apples with the Monterey Jack Chicken Wrap. The staff was very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

luT3ckjpENO8JUKTdmJvUQ.text: No atmosphere here, and it's even getting a little seedy lately. I have been going here probably twenty years, since right after they opened when a roasted chicken was a novelty and before they were available un every grocery store. What brings me back is the many excellent veggie sides offered. I recommend the four cheese pasta, the white beans with garlic and the sauteed vegetables. But all are good and I have tried them all! The mini loaves of cornbread are cute and very good. And, of course, the chicken is always perfect, tender and moist consistently. I get the quarter chicken, and have sometimes gotten the entree with black beans. Everything is totally delicious here. I just wish they would clean and spruce up a little bit in the atmosphere. And sometimes tables are left piled with previous diner's leavings, so it's hard to find a clean place to sit. If the food were not so good that would turn us away.

0X82Aj3jLaNUlE-TMMl-SQ.text: OMG I love this place. The smoked gouda pasta I come here for that mainly as well as the squash casserole. I love the chicken as well as the chicken pot pie and chicken and dumplings. If I could eat here everyday for lunch I would. unfortunately it take to long for me to get there for lunch as often as I would like. they have opened a second location though which is a bonus.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kids meal and it still came wh cornbread yes
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetable plate

0-Uy_oX5jrhX_UBoMSLGdQ.text: A charlotte classic! So much so, i probably take it for granted.  A love that they keep it simple, just great food, prepared quickly!   Hard to find better quality on a daily basis.  Dish and Roasting Company definitely have the best top to bottom options for sides!  You have to try the "squash casserole" at Roasting, it's delicious...even if you aren't a squash fan.  My go to entree is their smothered "Chicken on Rice con Queso"   They also have daily specials that never disappoint.  Also, A bunch of local beers on tap at the bar.    Roasting pulls off the trifecta....they are good for a quick in and out lunch, grabbing drinks and snacks with friends or a casual sit down dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Friday BBQ Meatloaf special with Squash Casserole!

O4vhb3HDuvoWI7FfBdofPA.text: Great place ! Great atmosphere! It's already my second time here and I'm sure coming back ! The staff is very nice and it's always full of people ! Its very recommended to come here on the weekend .

tYyBtN8Sy8iTTgrPsaLAGQ.text: Nothing complicated, nothing fancy, nothing expensive. Just good food served quick! Although a bit confusing for newbies like ourselves we weren't sure if it was a table service spot or a self serve serve spot. We decided to order from the self service location because they seemed friendlier than the bartending area.    I rarely order chicken when I go out to eat but it seemed fitting at this location and I'm glad I did! It was delicious and moist and flavorful! Their sides were also delicious! Garlicky potatoes, baked beans and even the Dill Potato Salad was good. Their pork Tacos were great! Not stingy with the pork they were very juicy and filling.    So after you place your order your food will be served up nice and hot and very quickly! Pick any table and enjoy! Their sweet tea is THUMBS UP!

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious 1/4 Chicken with two sides being Garlicky New Potatoes and Baked Beans. The cornbread was also delicious
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice and Hot Chips! 99 cents!

vc-44JsF4d4y-_VkOptDeA.text: I stopped in for lunch with my coworkers and the place was packed! But lucky for us the line moved quickly.   I chose the Monterey Wrap. First, it's huge! Trust me...you'll have a really hard time finishing all of it!  Second, they do not skimp on the chicken or toppings. This wrap had chicken, black beans, rice, onions and peppers and the best part - they top all that with queso! I really loved the flavor of the rotisserie chicken. So tender and flavorful! For my side I chose the white bean au gratin. It was very tasty as well! I was stuffed and happy and you can't ask for more than that!   All in all this is a pretty solid lunch spot. I definitely look forward to trying more of the menu items.

E02CTEMZZC9I6is6uxlu6g.text: Updated: I went back after the manager contacted me following my previous review. I ordered the same meal and it came out in 2-3 minutes. My previous visit was an aberration, glad to have RoCo back in the rotation. Good food, insane portion sizes, and fair price. Good stuff.

f_scxaO6DhvUCzYHp1hwEg.text: Great food first off. I had a little hiccup with a online order i placed but they took care of the issue with haste. Will definitely be back again soon!

HyEVLEjI6enUg4DnB4AEkA.text: It's a simple plate of food that can fill you up at the end of a night of great times and good laughs. It's tasty and if they don't have enough flavor there's plenty of house sauces that can help. I would always return. I normally order chicken con queso. With pasta salad and apples. Do you want hand made food or made by hand, trust me there's a difference.

sZCK4XVbg62r03CCKJfaIA.text: I had the chicken and squash and vegetables. Absolutely loved their squash! Portions are perfect! The wait wasn't too long either. Parking is a bit tight.

fS_EOJnfHiMEp6aEZw_cWw.text: Food was good. We were there at a quieter time, it seemed. The wife thinks their pulled pork sauce that was intended to be "BBQ", should be more "BBQ" than terriyaki base. I didn't have any complaints. We both agreed we would come back. Overall, good "hole in the wall" find.

jwvtXt7DQlDYCK-N1uB98g.text: We had gotten recommendations to try out The Roasting Company from a few friends. Maybe it was an off night, but we were pretty disappointed.    I ordered the rotisserie chicken with black beans & queso. When I got my order almost 40 minutes later (it was busy, but not THAT busy), there was no queso. I went back up to get it which was fine. Even with the queso, which I eventually dumped the whole thing into, my meal was pretty bland. The sides were nothing to write home about either. The "buttered" spinach was awful, and the garlic potatoes were decent. Maybe we will give it another shot down the road...

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

fJm_Q2TgtF7haOlGPs8xfQ.text: Very good roasted chicken served as 1/4, 1/2 or whole.  I had 1/4 chicken with Mac n cheese and a tossed salad.  Chicken was hot and tasty, not spicy.  Mac 'n cheese had a little spicy kick that added to the flavor.  Ordered to go and it was ready within 5 minutes. Hot and fresh.  Very reasonably priced and open late. Adjacent bar had outdoor seating and was very lively.

Bw6z1XCQiTN7vEAmZIPiEw.text: Bones bones and more bones!! Warning to those who shovel food into their mouth with food that SHOULD be boneless. More likely than not, your chicken con queso or chicken pot pie will have numerous bones in them. While their food is tasteful, it may be hazardous to your life !! This photo is a chicken con queso over rice which SHOULD be boneless. This is not an isolated case. Happens every visit. They should put warning signs on these plates!

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

zINg4QHw6wNkKXzkgGl7rA.text: It has been years since I have actually eaten here, but I stopped in for some beers with some friends last night and the vibe hasn't changed one bit.  Nothing fancy, but friendly and quick service was all I was looking for.  I don't know that I have much to say here, since I didn't get any food.  A great place to grab some beers.  Some awesome $3.50 beer specials.

_hgCT8YAYl3gAQsIMrZy5A.text: This is a unique restaurant w/great choices and a nice vibe.  I had the chicken and rice w/ sauce.  I enjoyed how different it was and how the flavors blended nicely.  If you are looking for some chicken instead of barbecue, give The Roasting Company a try.

JKu9ssooDQ6Tdw5dfdr-jg.text: I was extremely excited about eating here but my food tasted like they threw it in the microwave & warmed it up.. not freshly made AT ALLLL... my bf had honey hot wings & they were the absolute top 5 wings I've had in my life! Maybe they were in a rush but I was so upset

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

dcyD-JqiSiqvuG480kxxgA.text: I ate today at the Roasting Company after church, with my family. The food was good we all enjoyed what we ordered. We said our goodbyes and went home and when I got home I realized my bag was missing, I rushed to call to see if it was turned in and sure enough the bar tenderer had my bag! I am extremely grateful to whoever turned it in and thank you to the customer service of the Roasting Company! I will defiantly return!

LJc8nb4q80yN_MJHnk_zag.text: Brisket on rice is awesome. As is everything I've had here m. Chicken and black beans over rice is great. Next time trying the Texas chili!

meHkC6MwurKlSk5KjOJPrw.text: This place is reliable for a good solid meal.  When you want veggies with your rotisserie chicken this is the place in town to get a square meal.   My suggestion for sides are the squash casserole and the white beans au gratin along with any chicken entree.    I've determined there are cracks in the fasod as the last visit the service had gotten really, really slow, as I ordered on line and even though they weren't busy, it took over a half hour to scoop up a veggie plate.  Realizing that the neighborhood has become millienumfied, they have added a bar and raised their prices where the value is not quite as good as it has been.  I realized that Doug the owner is spreading himself thin with the purchase of Providence Road Sundries and two other ROCO locations but come on this is in an old Lil Greneral C Store location so he needs to keep in sight on how this original location became successful in the first place.
