4_wK3_xLUEay38ee2JDMmg.text: Chicken Roasting Company is like your favorite pair of old jeans- soft, comfy, faded, make your butt look good (ok maybe a bit far). Anyway, it's the place you can go when you're so hungry you can't make up your mind what you want to eat. The place is casual, comfy and has quick counter service. There are a few outside tables, and a big tv always on sports. It's good for kids too.  The menu focuses on, er, chicken. My favorite is 1/4 white, With 2 sides. That means a 1/4 of a rotisserie roasted chicken (you can also get dark of even a half a chicken). each day in addition to their great regular sides, they  have a few special sides. My favorite special side is the spicy Mac & cheese only on Saturdays, but their regular sides of Tico black beans (which keeps turning into Ticonderoga on my iPad -DYAC!!), cornbread stuffing, sauteed veggies and mashed sweet potatoes are also great. In fact, the mashed sweet potatoes taste like pumpkin pie. Mmm, pie...There are some sides I don't love as much, so just find what you like.   The menu also offers a couple entrees like chicken and rice, wraps (veggie wrap is good but is juicy so maybe ask to go light on the dressing or on the side) all for very reasonable prices. The 1/4 white plate is $6.80. It is equally friendly to the pocketbook and the stomach.  The only problem? I don't live as close to Park & Woodlawn anymore, so it's not as convenient.   Bottom line: great place to get a solid meal for not much moolah when you're in your sweats.

DokcnuTexqrn17-ritMZzg.text: Local craft beer and sweet corn bread with jalapeno in it!? Wow this place has it going on!

StZrUJFVlecTQ2J5FW89Zg.text: Go here now. Squash casserole is CRAZY. The chicken queso dish is fabulous. I've had a hard time finding something I don't love here. Everything tastes so fresh and fast service. Big portions as well.

t07ZsxLltaRUM199vrc4Ew.text: We were in Charlotte for one night after a 10 day vacation, this place was close and had good reviews. We wanted something fast and good before heading to the airport early. The atmosphere is nice, good beer selection and plenty of TV's to watch football.  The food on the other hand was uninspiring and bland. The chicken was dry, the rice had parts that were not completely cooked. The greens were very bland, but salvageable with pepper sauce. The new potatoes and squash casserole were decent.  If I lived here I would only return for beer.

g-UwvK1VGDu0oBaRSYzJCg.text: Good food but lately poor execution.  I usually order the Monterey chicken wrap.  The first time I ordered it I had to learn the hard way that by "peppers" on the menu description they mean jalapeno peppers (not bell peppers which I assumed).  Well the following two times Ive ordered this I ask for no jalapeno peppers.  They add it anyway.  Lastnight I bit into something hard TWICE.  Two 2" chicken rib bones.  Come on man.  Im done with this place.

f46H-FtpMfEierRNoKjx1A.text: Great food, good prices. Everything tastes fresh. The pasta with smoked cheese (pasta salad) is amazing. The service is quick and friendly. They have a decent selection of beers on the shelf, including my fiance's favorite, Imperial from Costa Rica.   Their home made hot sauce is amazing, you can put it on pretty much anything. Not too hot, not too mild, just full of flavor and it has a chunky-like consistency.

lp_Z-ccU4b0o3e88UmfUHg.text: Best prepared food for the money in Charlotte period. Now with a great porch and local beer bar, do not visit Charlotte and miss this joint. 5 stars all around.

g6SpkANpKHYbO6klmovjlA.text: Tonight I had their special: Southern BBQ Wrap, and as my side I ordered the Squash Casserole ($8.99) Both were outstanding, and the Southern BBQ Wrap may be my new favorite! I don't always walk away remembering food, but I'll remember that wrap! You must try it!

2chtYcUJsqPuDLSTRIn_RQ.text: Hadn't been in years. Now there is a bar. Food is frozen in time - same exact stuff as ten years ago. Mediocre.

CfQfriaeg1ZDP_kAcqCfrA.text: All in all, this was a borderline 2 star trip for me based solely on my satisfaction with my food. Service was good, i mean the order taker was friendly. Right at the get go, they do have a tip jar. Being my first trip, i gave a small tip feeling like a jackass if i didn't (albeit a small tip). Come to find out, i place my order, then i pick up my own food and fill my own drink, grab my own silverware, and you want a tip for what? Ooooh, i see there is no place to throw away my own trash. i guess that makes me feel better for leaving some tip.     Anywho, walking in on a Monday to see that the special is a buffalo chicken wrap  felt like a good omen to me. Unfortunately, my wrap left me to continue my search for a favorite buffalo chicken wrap in Charlotte. At first, i thought they just forgot to put any buffalo sauce on it.  Perhaps they thought i ordered the bland chicken wrap instead? Then it started to have a little flavor, but not much and by the bottom of the wrap, it was a soggy diaper wrap. i tried to add flavor with various salsa and sauces on the table, but couldn't quite satisfy the taste buds.  The squash casserole was pretty good, but i found myself leaving half of it behind not even wanting to finish it. Same with the sweet potato fries, just kind of bleh.  My favorite part of the trip was when she put my order slip on the thing and threw it down the line to the cook dudes. i'm easily entertained.

wB4m7Js2zh_HSGsCtFLFfA.text: The Roasting Company is hella dope! I just got four sides of veggies and it really made a complete meal. It tasted like home-cooked food like grandma would make, if my grandma were Southern, that is. I got the squash casserole, the cheesy grits, the collards, and the green beans, and then because of a mixup I got the apples for free, those things are so good. The only thing I didn't really care for were the green beans, they seemed like they were from a can and I'm not a big fan of canned food. The prices were awesome- my plate came with a really good little cornbread muffin and was just over $5. If I lived in the area I would eat here often for sure. It also had a homey ambience. The customer service was great. The people working there are super friendly and sweet. Roasting company hit the spot when I was craving something healthy Southern style food with a lot of vegetables, and I was very glad that the veggies didn't have any meat added to them!

VPRhlqi-4xgD_GndBlD5mw.text: For a quick, delicious, cheap (did I say delicious) chicken lunch or dinner in town, look no further than the Roasting Company. Not much decor to speak of, but when all meals come out in under 5 minutes and cost less than $10, fancy decorations are unnecessary.   My two favorite meals are the chicken and black bean con queso and the half white meat chicken breast. Both are cooked to perfection, and I can get at least two meals out of one order. The corn bread muffins are also very good (be sure to order additional because you'll want more than one - it's worth it at only $0.35 each), and if you go on Saturday, you can get the mac 'n cheese, which has a kick and is my favorite side item offered. The squash casserole and the sweet potatoes are also quite good.   Ultimately, I recommend the Roasting Company for a quick meal or takeout on those days where you just don't want to cook or need a quick lunch.

JcN0PZUE5UcEOiOy0i235A.text: OK Peeps, let's get it straight-this place is not Tex-Mex or Jamaican, its Costa Rican style food.  Whenever you see "tico" on anything, it refers to Costa Rica.  Plus cornbread made from heaven and collard greens for randomness.  When I visited RC, I was suprised by the daring mix of Costa Rican food and Southern food.  The smell of rotisserie chicken makes my heart sing, anyway, but it was even better to eat.  For around $8, I got an entire meal of rotisserie chicken, black beans, and spinach.  I ordered spinach to be healthy (must have been sick or something) and was shocked at how good  it tasted!  Not to mention the chicken...  This place is very homely-located above a rowdy Karaoke bar.  I applaud them for being so deliciously weird.  A salsa bar (as in sauce for tortilla chips, not the music), collard greens, mac n cheese, and tico beans?  The clientele is awesomely mixed as well, young, old, hip and square.  This place is proof that Charlotte does have its own gastronomical character.

ZJkUay6Sa4cGLELh-chjWw.text: Love this place, great portions and great prices. I've never had anything I didn't like. Staff is always friendly and and always seem to be enjoying their job and seem to actually care whether or not they are putting out a quality product.

ZWkLOeWuoUUn0PqNSaPJtw.text: Fast, good, cheap chicken... Quarter, half or full size...great flavor Sides, sides, sides...mac & cheese, casserole, sweet potato casserole, etc etc.  Most items are under $10. Food comes out in less than 5 minutes and you can sit inside or outside. This place is great for lunch or for dinner by yourself or with friends or family. Bowling alley and movie theater are close by making this a great place for a fast, inexpensive meal!

3vHvSnIL2SqmD4nHbQncmA.text: Ordered from here for some anniversary food (I recently lost my job, so this was the best I could do).  Got teriyaki bbq wings, 1/2 white with smoked cheese and pasta and basil green beans, and 1/2 dark with smoked cheese and pasta and squash casserole. THE WINGS ARE AMAZING; absolutely delicious. I wish that was all I ordered.  My 1/2 white was dry and didn't taste remotely like rotisserie chicken (rotisserie should be perfectly moist all the way through). The smoked cheese and pasta was more like pasta salad than macaroni and cheese (I guess that green stuff in it was spinach), and the basil green beans tasted straight from the can (NO FLAVOR, not even salt and pepper). The 1/2 dark was the same (dry) and my girlfriend liked the squash casserole (has corn in it), but DID NOT like the smoked cheese and pasta. The cornbread has chunks of corn in it, and I'm not talking about fresh corn (the kind that tastes candied and gets stuck in your teeth easily).  I will only be ordering wings from now on. I might be tempted to get the girlfriend their spicy cheese grits if we ever order on Wednesday.

SPyooaLK0L3hmuFoUPQmiA.text: I used to frequent this place several years ago at lunch time and thought I would stop in for take out since I was in the area yesterday!  Well, I seriously have had better chicken from a can.  YUCK! I got the Chicken on rice with Queso, the Queso was like water, the texture of the chicken was just weird.  The Squash casserole was okay, but not great.  I remember I used to love the smoked pasta salad, well it had a strong vinegar flavor that I do not remember.  Most of my 9$ lunch ended up in the trash.

b4rCpvzz4lPQoAJX_eSnzA.text: I honestly don't get what the big deal is with this place...   I've eaten here 2 - 3 times with coworkers who rave about it but it seems to me that its just a confused Boston market with lower quality food.

gV4OmTtdnaUAo1No6nECzA.text: Oh Roasting Company, you have been around for as long as I can remember.  Everyone I have ever taken here has always had nothing but good things to say about you.  I always get the con queso or jerk sauce over the roasted chicken and rice and the squash casserole is awesome, need I say more!

OEPdqXi-S_fhw9QUofiCdw.text: This was such a nice surprise! We have gone to this restaurnat a few ties now, and it always delivers. The chicken is melt in your mouth good! And the squash caserole out of this world. My daughter always has the jerk pork sandwich...and that does not disappoint either. And the pricing is very reasonable! From what I hear, you can order whole chickens to take home, too; although we haven't done that yet. If you like chicken, you can't go wrong ordering 1/4 or 1/2 with 2 sides. The new potatoes are great, and my daughter likes the cinnamon apples.

1MZLa5CuFS6WxbecAuVmqQ.text: I sometimes eat at the roasting company after work or grab something for the family. It is quality chicken and the squash casserole is amazing. I really like the feel of the place after they remodeled it last year. Definitely a great place if you like a rustic look and feel with good food / drinks and don't feel like getting fancy.

D1yKNv-_m8Vo4pMBh9xLag.text: I have been searching for a proper chicken pot pie since the weather got colder & saw here on Yelp that the Roasting Co had chicken pot pies on Wednesdays.  Clearly, I had to check it out.  I did get it to go, so I can't say much on the restaurant itself, other than it's surprisingly roomy inside.    Their chicken pot pies don't mess around.  The thing is massive!   It's chock full of veggies & perfectly moist chicken with a thin golden crust.  My only complaint is there's not as much crust as I would like, but it's still a great pot pie.  Can't wait to go back & check out what else they have to offer!  Also, they have Uncle Scott's Root Beer from Mooresville.  Best Root Beer I've tasted.

vakMsqmC8b9ob5Y_vtE40g.text: The food was great.  I had a 1/2 chicken with Okra and tomatoes and squash casserole.  My date had 1/4 chicken white with cornbread dressing and slaw.  If was generous portions and the tab was $20 which is incredible!

BwEXP-4l5YAfx5rcme5RfQ.text: I stopped here one lunchtime with a couple of coworkers who recommended the place.  After seeing the outside of the building, I was a little dubious --it felt like there should be a 50 gallon drum outside with a roaring fire and a couple homeless folk keeping warm.  Once we got into the building, that thought didn't go away.  The restaurant itself was a bit, hmm, used, maybe --lets just say it looked though it was in need of some updating.    When you walk in you're presented with a board and a bunch of menu items; right beneath is where you order. --If you've never been before, it might be helpful to checkout their online menu prior to going, otherwise you may be deciding on something in a split second --especially if there is a line behind you.  Soon as you've placed your order, you're shuffled off to the side in True McDonald's style and you wait for your food the be thrown up on a grab-it-yourself servers shelf.  Waiting for the food I had all kinds of interesting thoughts flying through my mind on what it might be made from.  However, that didn't have to last that long --it took ~4 minutes to serve up my hot lunch --a whole minute quicker than the average Chinese joint; that's impressive!  I got the food and I was very pleasantly surprised.  It looked just like a home-cooked meal --not one which had been ordered in a restaurant.  It smelt amazing, looked fantastic, and only took 4 minutes --that's enough to make Stouffers jealous!  Again, to my surprise the food was extremely tasty.  The chicken they use was actually off a full cooked chicken and not from a frozen bag.  There was some salt in the meal  that had been added for taste but not a crap load of MSG flavoring all over the rice to make it taste unnatural --it almost reminded me of when I was a kid and the food was made by mum.  This isn't your typical eat-out kind of restaurant.  If you want a nice home cooked meal without cooking it; this is the place.  It was a nice refreshing change from the typical lunchtime eatery you find.  I will certainly be going here again, I really did enjoyed the food, despite the interesting appearance of the place.

2Q1sQtNI5huakXpS-SezTQ.text: We love Roasting Company!  Been eating here for years.  Would have given them 5 stars except I'm sitting here waiting for a huge to go order I placed yesterday, which they had no record of :-(.

K9LnZqDmmdbnjwMQhq_p0Q.text: Chicken Pot Pie Wednesdays... How I love thee!!!  I have only been here on Wednesdays and it's the only day that they serve up the Chicken Pot Pie meant for the Gods.  They only make a certain number for the day but if you get there before 12:30pm, then you should be fine.  It really starts getting crowded after 12pm.  The Pot Pie is large and you really concentrate hard if you want to finish it in one sitting.  There is no shame with taking the rest home and saving it for late night grub.  Still good!!  Also, definitely try the green sauce on the table.  Mmmmmm mmmm.  Although I haven't tried the other food there (BBQ Homestyle), I've only heard the best things.  So give it all a try.  But honestly, 5 stars for the Pot Pie.  Enjoy!  -Ian M.

SwBjls9X1JanpU4Q7de35A.text: Have been here three times in two weeks--delicious! Just wish their lunch specials were offered other days as well (even if it's not at a "special" price). Like their buffalo chicken sandwich a lot! Wings are tasty, renovation looks nice, more room to sit.

LkEK7mCnR7CbFDdWPz29bQ.text: Great place and great atmosphere now with the new renovations. Incredible beer selection as well and very friendly staff.

tU_ZDB_r5IZCMDe4kfRklw.text: Decent lunch place for a quick and easy meal. Chicken is good and well plated. An array of side dishes available to suit all customers. Pricing is fair and inexpensive. A no frills chicken joint that's all about the chicken!

6FzaYOLUiiPNPT8_a7yzfg.text: Good menu. Veggies, tacos, queso and chips are excellent. Used to love the chicken and queso over rice. The last couple of times the chicken was dry and they were stingy with the queso.

BkV27FwlnKi5_EpboFReNg.text: Love the salsa bar and smoked cheese pasta. The staff is always nice. My wife likes the wraps and black beans. I always get the quartered dark chicken. Parking can be tight though.

ZhugEf09FGgpSvsBptAdpg.text: The Roasting Company has become a go-to lunch spot for me.  Their rotisserie chicken is at the center of the menu: they do sell other proteins, but you need to try the chicken on your first visit.  Pretty much any form of it is a winner, except on top of a green salad.  The chicken itself is fine, of course, but you can find better veggies elsewhere.  If you can't decide and want to start off with something distinctive, get the chicken on rice with jaco sauce.  It's spicy, tangy, and filling.  The sides here are really good as well.  If you feel like indulging yourself, try the pasta with smoked cheese.  This isn't your run-of-the-mill mac and orange-stuff.  If you want to be healthier, the black beans are the way to go.  Oh, and to make everything even better, there's a salsa bar.    My only caution is that parking can be ... exciting.  It's cramped.  Check over both shoulders before you back out, folks.

uaPqiELTsAPpK8AzLnMgqA.text: The rotisserie chicken was really good. I got the stir-fry veggies and squash casserole for sides and they were tasty as well, although I was expecting something more home made feeling with the casserole. The corn bread was okay, I prefer the square to the muffin types. The soda (Cherry Coke) machine tasted like it needed a calibration, too syrupy. I would certainly return.

Q_IlJX0Q3yfVkkiyVLy9SQ.text: Its a Charlotte staple, a locally owned business, the stop that's outlasted every venue on Montford.  I've been coming to Roasting Co since I was in middle school, in my 30's now I still stop in monthly.  The food is still classic, the establishment has grown.  Full bar with a few TV's for sports, amazing fresh roasted chicken, and some homemade hot sauce.  Go on Wednesday, get the daily special Chicken Pot Pie, it will feed two.  Take home a cup of queso and chips, it will make you fat and happy.  Buy a tee shirt, support the fam.  Any other questions, stop in to get the answers.

EhyqBEZX74xTZ143SDFdqQ.text: My friend checked this place and there are lot of good reviews. So we tried it. Big mistake. The food has no taste. Drink if you want flavor.

AeElEBWKYT3aAD5lzzeKNQ.text: Chicken was actually cooked completely done ( so many places rush the meat :/)  and moist; however lacked umph. Good chicken-not as flavorful as Viva. The sides here are more variety than the usual french fries&mashed potatoes. We love black beans!The squash casserole and smoked cheese pasta salad were yummy.  The spinach in the pasta salad was an unexpected pleasant surprise.  Corn muffins had real bits of corn. The place is like McAlister's where you order and leave your name. Get your food and leave your plates. Nothing fancy and sometimes that is a good thing :) So I can only speak on service of cashier. She was efficient and cordial.  Prices are very affordable and under $11 per entree. Will add to our dining out rotation.

PbHm62uQQ9_rR64ZwkK43Q.text: Went to watch the game there and oh my it was amazing! The squash bake is to die for!

ZNK1ybyB8kY5QZ9NLcAlZQ.text: I often pick up an order to go and it is always ready in a very short amount of time.  I LOVE the rotisserie chicken salad.  It's huge and always a ton of meat piled on top.  The roasting company is consistent and always delicious!

PPrrlmF9t0aCtIIwG_hffg.text: For what they do, they do it really well.  Great eat n run kind of place.  Parking can be a challenge, but it's not the size of their lot, it's the quantity of people heading there for a midday meal.  Their claim to fame is their rotisserie chicken - they serve it in a variety of ways...... in a tortilla with rice and beans, over a salad, smothered in queso, with mayo in a chicken salad, etc.  I haven't had a bad chicken dish yet.  Portions are on the above-avg side.  They also have daily specials......CPP on Wednesdays is a solid choice, but my go-to special is the Meatloaf on Fridays.  Probably my favorite part of their menu is their side dishes.....squash casserole, mashed sweet potatoes, black beans, garlicky new potatoes, etc.  You can just order the veggie plate and walk out extremely satisfied.  Service is fast.....order at the counter, then they call your name to pick it up in a few minutes (sometimes your order is up before you finish paying).    Nothing fancy about the decor, but it works.

xiIIrUeioaIhVeGj4qtzqw.text: Roasting Company to me is like a Boston Market substitute (gasp!!!).  It's not that it's not good, but I just like Boston's chicken a little better because it's seasoned a little better.  But since Roasting Co. is close to work, it is a nice alternative when I plain refuse to go to yet another fast food joint.    The food is fast, consistently decent and relatively cheap.  I normally get the quarter dark, but today I decided to get a half dark (which is only $1.53 more) and now I have leftover for another meal... much more economical :)  Seasoned corn was a little disappointing for it's not seasoned much.  Squash casserole was ok, not super cheesy so I feel like I was being semi-healthy.  Overall the veggies were both little too blend for my taste.    It's a solid place for lunch, especially they have a few outdoor tables so we can also get a dose of Vitamin D on a sunny day.

Tl2tXp9eWAU2n6lxMbpnGA.text: The chick rice queso dish is good! All the sides were good. The service was awesome! I have nothing negative to say about this place. I would recommend it to anyone looking for some yummy food.

Fgs5dIKus9sbQhD97TC10w.text: As a Charlotte Native, RoCo is always on the top of my list of recommendations for Charlotte newcomers. I'm one of those boring people who order the same order (chicken, rice, queso) every time, but have been occasionally swayed by some outstanding specials. Don't sleep on the buffalo chicken wrap if it's available.   Let's talk sides: if you're a collard green person, get the collard greens. If you pretend like you're not a collard green person, try these. They are the way God intended collard greens to taste. If they have the mac and cheese: get it!   The inside of RoCo is comfy/casual, although I do think their booths are in dire need of an upgrade/reupholster. Can't wait for the plaza midwood location to open!

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken con queso
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

8EFpf6OduQQafgcRpwbmkg.text: Went in on a Friday night at around 11pm with a group of 9 people. Since the bartender was the only one there at that time and he had customers at the bar area we sat ourselves and ordered the 10 person party pack which included 3 1/2 rotisserie chickens, 4 quarts veggies, and 10 pieces of cornbread for $74.90. It was a great deal! There was plenty of food, the chicken was great, and the hot sauce they have made it even better. We also ordered the tico black beans, herb rice, and collard greens as our sides... We had no complains on any of those either. We really didn't have a server since the bartender was pretty busy, but the food alone made it a great experience.

UH-_UxRSLCb2M57Rtz8QEA.text: Not great. Ordered take out. Ordered the chicken con queso over rice. Very little queso which resulted in a very bland dish. Not much chicken, it was mostly rice. There was something I couldn't identify in my chicken, looked like an uncooked French Fry (maybe??). The rice was very watery. The mac and cheese was clearly noodles with queso poured over it. The upside is Charlotte has plenty of other restaurants so that I don't have to eat from here again.

bY8jzdCsnG_VcLnmj1SZOg.text: HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!! Lost a long term customer!!!!!!!Waited 10 minutes to get service, no menus, too lazy to help anyone. Will never return again.

TK06Q882E0b9x0A1yFEukw.text: This place goes to show that a simple concept can lead to great success!  Having bookmarked Roasting Company for some time, my latest stop in Charlotte propelled me to stop in!  A little confusion as to where to go and what to do, without anyone at the front to explain, I figured out to go through the dining area to the back right area to order.  From suggestions from a employee, I ordered the Chicken Black Bean Combo and a 1/2 Chicken with sides of Squash Casserole and Sauteed Veggies!    The combo is chunks of their rotisserie chicken over black beans and rice, then it's topped with a housemade queso sauce.  It's absolutely phenomenally good!  The squash casserole that I had with it was equally impressive!  The 1/2 chicken white, with a side of stir fry veggies, was again a impressive dish that due to the slow roasting of the chicken!  It literally falls off the bone and the stir fry will impressively surprise you!  My only knocks on the place is the lack of knowledge of what to do and where to go when you first go in.  The other is their way of calling out your order once it's ready.  The lady working the pass will literally scream your name out to the point that if you're sitting near that area, it's annoying as hell!  Your constantly bombarded with someone screaming throughout your meal!  The food is incredible, just bring your earbuds!

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/2 Chicken White!
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Black Bean Queso!

24hUOuKLCPUF0tTghz3v0A.text: We stopped in here for dinner one night. My husband and I shared half a chicken, green beans, baked cinnamon apples & garlic new potatoes. It also came with corn bread. I enjoyed the potatoes & apples but did not care for the green beans and didn't try the corn bread. The chicken was really juicy & good! I wish we had one of these in Florida!

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half a chicken with baked apples, green beans &amp; garlic potatoes
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

Jq4yoprqCZGYem0bvD1FsA.text: The Roasting Company is always a safe bet.  Succulent chicken and a variety of sides.  Go to the counter, tell the cashier what you want, and lickety split your order is ready.  Today I had a quarter chicken with dill lima beans and the cinnamon apples.  Those cinnamon apples were something to write home about!  It was served up with a corn bread muffin. Despite the fact they only had dark meat when I ordered, it was still tasty.  I do wonder, however, how a chicken place can run out of white meat. Hmmmm.   It's in a warehouse kind of building and it was jumping with millennials.   I was there representing the baby boomers.   Apparently the other boomers stayed home today.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

G4KwvcsT3NKE-dFo7uE_0A.text: Came in on a Wednesday while visiting Charlotte.  Took an Uber from my hotel to grab a late dinner.   The smoked pasta salad and squash casserole were good. The rest of the food was way too bland. I dumped a quarter of a bottle of Tico sauce on it to try to pep it up.  It didn't work :/    I got the Jaco sauce on the side. My husband liked it, I didn't. Probably because I don't like bbq sauce, soy sauce or teriyaki and I believe it's some sort of combo of those.  Overall,  I'd skip this place next time I'm in town but some other Yelpers had better luck.  Tip: Go in under the "Roasting Co" sign and go to your right to order.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Signage
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked pasta salad
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Squash casserole

y9Hx3kcASte1Xv0WvXXWRw.text: I'm pretty sure I love every single side item in this place. That's right, I'm the girl who goes to the bangin' chicken place and orders all the sides.   The Roasting Company is one of those places that just feels comfortable. The food is great and the vibe is laid back. You'll see a line at lunch time. Don't worry, it moves pretty quickly. They crank out some food here.   I always get a vegetable plate of some sort. The smoked cheese and pasta salad is one of the best sides you'll find in Charlotte. I switch up my other choices based on my current modd. The white beans au gratin, basil green beans, squash- it's all good. I'll stop before I basically just list their entire side item menu. The chicken con queso is delicious. They also have different daily specials. Wednesday is chicken pot pie day. I recommend getting there early because they sometimes run out.   They have a ton of local beers. The Tico sauce- I don't really know what it is, but it's freaking delicious. I put it on everything. There's also a location in Rock Hill and they're opening one in Plaza Midwood. Happy dance.   As if you need any other reason to come here, Luke Kuechly ate here the week before every game last season. The only week he missed- the one regular season game we lost against Atlanta.

X478kAdpV8S91OYGsQqjBA.text: Chicken is amazing. Im usually pretty picky about meat but it's super tender and the flavor is awesome. The sides are not all they are cracked up to be. I've eaten here quite a few times and found all the sides to be either over seasoned or not seasoned enough.

W9xD3Ev98vVg0NZP5md3KQ.text: Love everything about this place... Squash casserole Collards Cornbread dressing Chicken And killer salads.... Go often Montford Location...

yhVqqmwHLxO8asX7sgo3zw.text: YASSS. I don't usually eat southern food due to the lack of availability near me, but I love it here. The dark and white meat chicken were both nice and juicy, no dryness in sight. Their cornbread is delicious. I've never had cornbread that had corn in it before. The squash casserole is delicious. I've never had that either. Then again, I don't really eat casseroles. The atmosphere is very comfortable and the prices are cheap. There's parking all around if you can't find it in their lot.

gV5wqtDmM77mNfiL7emM1Q.text: The roasting company is a staple in Charlotte. One of my very favorite restaurant. Casual dining with flavor bursting everywhere. My favorite is the barbecue chicken wrap. But honestly I could just live off the squash casserole. Done in or out,  lots of options. They do a serious lunch crowd. So come early or be prepared to wait just a bit. It will be so worth it.

ekJ0RG2XF2BqZlcHruy0pg.text: Wings are good!  Hot honey is what I like.  Chicken nachos are worth trying.  I've eaten here several times and I have never had a bad meal.

PDPeiijYayA9qQi5Anb5cw.text: Food was terrific and it came out to us in less than five minutes. The inside has an open floor plan and the noise level was moderate. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

4sZ21mZ1Jw3aL9QmlnlNCg.text: I actually had RoCo as my #1 rotisserie chicken spot in charlotte for a while. It might be a few other spots that's nipping at their heels now but this post is about them. Good, affordable, tender chicken and the sides are good. Every time I go it's pretty busy but I never have a problem with the environment there and I been at lunch and dinner time. I recommend this spot for yo coworkers and family.

7USWPpzX2XmzW-UyuqURBQ.text: Unfortunately ROCO is truly overhyped in my opinion.   The booths have no cushion so are somewhat uncomfortable.   If you are lazy (like me) you have to pick up your own food.   I ordered the chicken and queso over rice with a side of sweet mashed potatoes, everything lacked flavor. My friend ordered potatoes, green beans, a pasta salad and squash casserole and everything lacked flavor expect the pasta salad which was delicious. Even the corn bread was somewhat dry.   The service is the reason I gave it two stars, very helpful and energetic.

8tnjqvxLkC0dJhEhHNXCBw.text: LOL. Normally I enjoy going to the Roasting Co amd my son loves wings.  So this morning I place an online order for wings and other items for a 5:30pm pick-up.   5:05pm they call to say they are an hour behind and will have to cancel unless I'm willing to wait.  Weird -I placed my order far before anyone getting their wings now.  I get it somebody screwed up but it will be remembered as they canceled an order 1.5 hours out from Super Bowl     Don't count on The Roasting Co for a timeline event that's for sure.

OsLChdBR6QzGB-5csps_Xg.text: So so good. The best chicken and dumplings I've ever had! The garlic roasted potatoes and little love bombs. Definitely adding this place to my rotation. You won't be disappointed.

31caa_ABr0tvrAsrjmn-WQ.text: Came here for dinner with friends and loved it! We had been hearing that they had really good vegetables. I will be the first to admit I was skeptical since they are a southern place but was excited to give it a try. I had the vegetable plate, for my sides I had the smoked cheese pasta salad with collard greens. I could have licked the plate it was delicious! Can't wait to go back and try some of the other vegetable items on the menu!

CwKXDxTTEb-GxC4PhCOq_g.text: My wife and I love this place.  I think we eat here about once a week.  The food is excellent and we feel like we're "eating healthy" (if we order the right dishes, of course) even while eating out.  I would classify it as "southern style" cuisine with dishes like pulled pork, chicken on the bone, and sides like collard greens (and a ton of others).  The chicken is phenomenal.  Always perfectly cooked. The bar at this place is great!  A little on the small side with only a handful of stools but the beer selection is excellent.  This is a full bar with wine and mixed drinks as well.  The parking can be a bit of a pain but that is True for every business on Montford St.  It's actually better than most places on Montford St. The few times I've used the salsa bar it's been a bit of a mess.  They could do better to keep that station clean and stocked. If you are in the mood for some good chicken, pork, and a bunch of excellent side choices, try this place out.  You won't regret it!

jMx-3_2MBN64OqZ-2n6Now.text: How did I let so much time pass between visits to this place?!  The chicken and black bean combo is an absolute favorite.  Add in a couple of tasty sides, and a cornbread muffin, and I am one satisified (and stuffed) puppy!  Am I the only one who ponders copping a bottle of their sauce(s)?

38uyVCK7hMHH462qjDEM9A.text: Used to eat there a lot 18 or more years ago, the food is still as awesome as it was back then, there is nothing I can say to describe how exceptionally awesome their food is all I can say is drop whatever your doing, cancel any plans you had and jump in an Uber and get over there right now, you won't be disappointed.

aviO8fz6c-FRdcsr4maVGw.text: My favorite restaurant in Charlotte. A staple of Montford Dr. Best chicken in town. Legendary sides. Great bar area now. Quick. Priced right. Try the 1/4 white. Smoked cheese and pasta. Side salad. Can't go wrong.

vp9jIwWss57dUUX1DaYE9A.text: Food is good but service is terrible. They are only friendly to customers they know. Others are ignored for a long time before being attended to

D-2WF4d6OQ2zpt-BDrtMYw.text: This is probably my favorite place for lunch. The side items are so good it is hard to choose what to get. It can get crowded but it is worth the wait. My favorites are the wonderful pasta salad, their slightly smokey collard greens and the sweet potato fries are the best I have had. Love to dip them in their queso.

7QVPZDGxlpjDVnHndr_WBA.text: My favorite place on Montford right now because of the jalapeno pale ale from bird song brewery on tap. Also the portions are huge, definitely one of the best home cooking type placing around South Charlotte.

XCwIk-a9-qSLgwE8wwQhSg.text: This is just a cool place. Comfort food is my favorite and I love how I can basically order a thanksgiving meal in the middle of summer if I wanted to.

6ws6FWEerREVP-EmbV9TmA.text: Very bland food, no flavor.  Unimpressed. Quiet atmosphere. Will not be return.

1v8FKg-G-kl6-5JNuT11PA.text: Must have. Squash casserole. Mashed sweet potatoes. And the Monterrey chicken wrap. My hubby's favorite lunch in Charlotte.

D0Czu56gboBCfd0_cyAFjA.text: Holy Squash Casserole...heaven! My boyfriend loves this place so we went for lunch here on Saturday and I was very impressed. It is priced right and the food is delicious. I also enjoy any place with cherry coke on tap!   I went with the Tarragon chicken salad on a kaiser roll with garlicky potatoes as my side. My boyfriend had the Monterrey wrap with casserole. My potatoes were ok and sandwich good but the casserole is where it's at! I wish they had it on their menu (it's a special) because I could eat that as my meal alone!   I'll definitely be back!

GxPcdafuAh8gWLXYg1ILRA.text: I love all the food here. The chicken is juicy, flavorful and tender. Squash casserole is delish though I feel like it has more breading in it than it used to a few years back. Monterey Chicken Wrap is so good. This is where I go when I dont want to feel guilty about not making dinner for the family. Feels like a home cooked meal and you can order a balanced plate :)

3I0ZksRnVdo_lN8sov-ycA.text: I had been here before and was excited to return back. Unfortunately the staff behind the counter was very rude when I was there and that was only when I wasn't being ignored by them.  I then remembered s similar experience with them years ago. My workplace moved to a block away from this restaurant and I also plan food for social events in the office. Unfortunately I won't be going back to The Roasting Company for myself or work functions.

n3C1LY8tnEvp46AuYTAUCw.text: After a long day working a festival, I decided to order food through FoodieCall for me and my family.  The menu for the Roasting company looked good, but my mistake was reading the reviews on yelp AFTER I ordered the food.  I ordered the marinated teriyaki chicken sandwich, the southern BBQ wrap, the jaco pork taco, the chicken salad sandwich and the Monterrey chicken wrap.    Not sure what happened for most of the reviews for this company have been good, but it seems as of September 2013, something drastic changed and their food quality went seriously downhill.  The teriyaki chicken sandwich was not seasoned at all and did not have any teriyaki on it, even though I asked for extra on the side plus the was a congealed lump of processed velveta- like  cheese mashed onto the chicken. The squash casserole was a paste with no flavor.  The BBQ pork was watery, runny, and not seasoned.  The BBQ sauce was also watery and runny and it seems they dumped a whole bottle of liquid smoke in the vat of BBQ.  The chicken salad was ok but not seasoned.  The Monterrey chicken was watery also and the beans were under done.    Foodie call was great and tried to help us by contacting the company to have the fix the issue.  We did have them send out different items for the items that majorly sucked (pork and Monterrey chicken), but to be honest, we are not really interested in the food or the replacements at this point.  I was starving at the time I told foodie call of the issue and after waiting an hour for the restaurant to remake the items and get them delivered, we already ate something else and now we have two more sandwiches that we don't really want.  They delivered the remakes and they screwed them up too!  They still didn't put teriyaki on the "marinated teriyaki chicken sandwich"!  Foodie call was able to get a full refund for this order and I thank them for that.  I will be ordering from them again....just not for the roasting company.    I would be very hesitant about eating at this restaurant until they revert back to their old way of cooking ...whatever they did before September 2013.  Or if you must go, maybe stick with the rotisserie chicken dishes and stay away wraps, sandwiches and pork.

wR3bQ6s8J2G1uPI39Gxixg.text: This truly is a Charlotte classic!  It has been around for many years (and how many restaurants in Charlotte could you apply that test to?) and the food is consistently excellent.  I usually get the veggie platter which has to be one of the best-priced options in the entire city.  And if you want to have a relaxing bar experience, go there at night time.  The laid back ambiance is awesome!  It is by far the best restaurant on Montford Drive.

cYTjwpSZTLiciFv01kFwnA.text: Yes, I can be a condiment queen, but I like to be able to play off the flavors that already exist in the dish... at the Roasting Company I feel like they're making me do all the work.   I get the appeal, I understand why this is a favorite of many friends, but it just isn't for me. (Clearly plenty feel they're doing something right if they're continually busy at standard meal times.) Either my sandwich is so loaded with meat and liquid (calling it sauce would mislead you to thinking it has a taste) it disintegrates faster than I can chew, or I feel like I just ate a plate of bland, watered down... what did I order? Luckily, there is a salsa bar and the tico sauce, but I want my pork to be able to contribute SOMETHING to my lettuce and tomato on tortilla.   I will admit, some of the sides are tasty. But with the options in town for rotisserie chicken and even tacos, this does not fall high on my list. Unlimited refills are nice, service is speedy, and the staff at the counter is friendly.

1XuFpHulZ4CHaGbsh2AEBw.text: Full plate and tasty! The people I went with said it's jamacian...I'm not familiar. It seems a bit of a combo of TexMex with the different salsas. The chicken is flavorful and there are varieties of sauces to add to your entree. Lots of great side dishes to select (e.g., collards, potato salad, beans) Anyway, it was a quick stop for a fast lunch.   The atmosphere is open and spacious. It's pretty chilly inside, so wear layers.

F3nsdElCwAyXN_XQXPC2WA.text: I came here for lunch with colleagues during the recent Teacher Workdays. I wasn't overly impressed. I ordered the chicken salad on a roll with a side of baked beans, and it was just nothing special. I usually like to go to lunch and be waited on, but we were in a hurry and a colleague suggested The Roasting Company. I have never been here, so I thought, what the heck,I'll try it. I figured it was pretty popular when we walked up to the restaurant and the line was almost out the door. The chicken salad was bland and the only thing I was really able to taste were  the walnuts added to it. The baked beans were too spicy and there was a jalapeno pepper sliced and mixed in with the beans. Overall, not impressed and wouldn't return.

MA0tyg2zYyn8GEGc0EM-sw.text: (Note, I've only been here once, but plan on going back...so this is a preliminary review!)  After several co-workers told me to give Roasting Company a try, I went in tonight on my dinner break, and wasn't disappointed!    I had the  dark, with a side of their black beans and squash casserole.  (Though Wednesdays is famous for their Chicken Pot Pie...which I told myself I'd have next time, for sure.) Not only did the food come out quickly, it was pretty cheap, I think about $7 with tax total.    The entree came with a really nice piece of cornbread--moist and warm and slightly sweet.  It was wrapped in foil, I presume to keep the moistness.  Nice idea.  The beans were nicely seasoned, as was the chicken.  The chicken is definitely delicious, with a nice, crispy skin.  Waaaay better than a Boston Market chicken.   But the star?  By far the squash casserole.  I know, connoisseurs of squash casserole will say "Dion!  This yellow mush doesn't count!  Where is the squash!?" because it really is more like stuffing, and mushy.  My co-worker, Devon and I were musing over what could be in it...we deducted butter and onions and breadcrumbs.  How can you not love it?  I particularly enjoyed the salsa bar, and the vinegar-y sliced white onions you can pile on your plate.    The only thing that bothered me, was the crazy number of tables that weren't cleared off.  Plates with crusty remnants of food, dried on them.  There must have been 10 tables with dirty plates and half-eaten food on them.  The bathroom also featured clogged up toilets.  Going on the food alone, I give this place 4 stars.  The selection is pretty good--with sides changing every day, and specials, like the pot pie on Wednesdays.    The prices are very reasonable, and the food comes out in about 5 minutes, if even.  A great alternative to fast-food...though they're going to have to work on keeping the place looking clean/nice.    PS:  I like how they mark "heart healthy" choices with a star.  Nice touch.

wxa2IkolkXtGXUYvCGbDWw.text: So happy for the RoCo that they are successful and expanding BUT..... the Montford Dr Store needs a little love, or at least an experienced manager. My husband and I have been eating at the Roasting Company once a week for years. While we have experienced an "off night " every now and again, the quality of the food and the friendliness of the staff and continued to decline over the past 6 months. While we understand staff turn over, I truly hope the RoCo management will take a hard look at the food coming out of the Montford Dr kitchen. There needs to be some consistency. It's pretty basic stuff that they have done so well for so long.  And a smile goes a long way.

afGSsGqV7Z8OAUk7n4qrDg.text: Super popular spot... the flavor of the chicken here is top notch and outshinea the rest of their fold.. not sure what they do to it in the kitchen, but I'm a fan.  Ordering here is pretty simple... not a ton of options on the menu, but enough to keep you coming back. The only thing I havent been a fan of is their sides... the "fresh " green beans TOTALLY came out of a can and sat in a warmer for a while.   It's also nice that they have a full bar to hang out at. Seems like the ideal spot to hit before a night of drinking

s94wRsYcKz5Ubssw-xwCYw.text: This was my first time visiting and it was great. I've always heard positive comments about The Roasting Company so I wanted to check it out.   I ordered the four side plate so that I'd have the opportunity to try multiple items - this was served with their homemade cornbread.  The Brussels were there daily side special, each day they do something off the menu to choose from. These were cooked really well, chopped with a sweet sauce.   The smoked cheese pasta salad was selected at the recommendation of the cashier. It was great. Big penne noodles with a cheese sauce, really filling.   Collards-- how can you go wrong? I did add their signature sauce to this side to take it up a notch. Loved them.  Garlicky Potatoes- another recommendation that I will forever order anytime I visit. Get this side!   I loved the environment, the friendly service and the large menu to choose from. They have a full bar available as well. Great lunch spot!

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Four side plate: Brussels (daily special), collard greens, smoked cheese pasta salad and garlicky potatoes. With cornbread!
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

iTlvjKp8NIuB_oFIzKrJKg.text: I've enjoy the rotisserie chicken and super sides at this neighborhood hang out for 30 years over which time it is evolved into as much as a casual sports bar as a diner. It does both well.  As a diner, everything is freshly made, delicious and, as evidenced by my photos, served in generous portions. All chicken options are winners and I love the black bean salad. Even the condiment bar, with sweet vinegary onions, and 3 different salsas including a red hot pico, is special. Unfortunately the corn bread was not. On my last visit it was cold, dry on the inside and soggy on the outside.  Of course, I do realize that's being a little picky, but hey, I love corn bread and was looking forward to it.  As a bar, it is nearly open air and has a real beachy vibe. The first time visitor would be as comfortable as the regular. There's decent draft beer choices and the usual bottled beer selection. Service is friendly and attentive at both.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

JWsLRW6IvOrpG2P4b5z6vw.text: I have been holding on this review for a few months.  After 4 visits I am now glad to provide a review.  It would have been much different if it were only after the first visit.  Working around the corner, this is working into my lunch rotation.  I ordered a wrap on my first visit which underwhelmed, but mainly because I wanted to eat it as a wrap.  It was so full of food you really need to eat it with a fork/spoon.  The filling was pretty good but the wrap got very soggy quickly.    I have since switched to the chicken and rice or the chicken pot pie.  Both were fantastic.  I suggest getting the sauce on the side of the chicken as it may be a bit overwhelming when it comes out on the chicken.  I also get a side of the black beans...  Wow!  I could eat just them for the meal.    The real prize is their chicken pot pie, the Wednesday lunch special.  It is huge. Strictly for the sake of a thorough review, I ate an entire one.  I was stuffed.  It came out hot and with a great amount of filling.  I love the fact it has crust on top and bottom.  It was not soggy and held up well.  With the size, it could easily feed two.  At the lunch special price it is a steal.  I am very glad I gave RoCo a few more shots.  I have become a convert and will keep coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

mtjYQie6l00a20dTdanvRw.text: This place is flying under the radar. I can't believe I didn't get around to trying it sooner.   We came on a Friday for lunch and it was pretty crowded. You order at the counter and then wait for your name to be called. We were able to find a seat in the dining room which is fairly big.   I decided to get the chicken and black bean combo con queso with a side of squash casserole. Everything was delicious. The chicken had a lot of flavor and queso makes everything better. The squash casserole was full of flavor too. My husband got the wings and really liked them. They have a salsa bar which is a nice touch.   Since it was crowded, it took a while for us to get our food which is understandable.   I highly recommend trying this place if you haven't already. We will definitely be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and black bean combo con queso with squash casserole

UgJviSCEDcchMnI3D-OFmQ.text: If you're looking for some delicious chicken in a small neighborhood vibe, you've found the right place. We went later in the evening during the week and sat ourselves. The bar was crowded, but there was plenty of seating available around the restaurant. I don't believe there were any servers there so we walked up to the bar to order.   I ordered the 1/4 chicken dark with a side of mashed sweet potatoes. The chicken was amazing and perfect cooked. It fell off the bone. The sauce was delicious as well and paired perfectly. I almost asked for some just to take home. The mashed sweet potatoes were ok. I did like that they weren't overly sweet as you find often. I do wish there was a server to refill drinks and such, but the bartender was able to complete our needs.

AYUvCPm1X6xkzth53SXv4g.text: Over the past 6 years my husband and I have ate here 3 times only because we've heard good things. As a bar it would be better if the draft beer wasn't warm. The food is downright gross. The meatloaf comes in mush form. The bbq sauce is terrible. We've made the decision we won't be back.

NzXtDyNTxBld2VJNolHdTQ.text: The quality of the food and service has really dropped since they've opened multiple locations.  I've been a frequent customer for at least 15 years but growing weary.  The last few times I've visited, the cashiers have acted like taking my order is an imposition.  The squash casserole yesterday was basically dressing with a few tiny bits of squash (it used to be predominantly squash) and the most recent time I ordered mashed sweet potatoes, it was a thin, watery mess.  Really disappointed to see the quality dropping at such a Charlotte staple.  On a positive note, on a recent visit, the chicken and dumplings were still terrific and the Brussels sprouts were as well.

DDVBAtp4Spchy8syAf3_og.text: Ordered through postmates and meal was just average thats about all I have to say on this.  Just bland, not very tasty or memorable.

TQ8SHzDYWho5JJtXbXdZtQ.text: Been coming here way before there was a yelp.  It's been a few years and I see an awesome new bar and everything updated a little more.  Nice place.  Great service.  Always loved this place the chicken is insane!   Saw Viva chicken over there.  I love Viva chicken too.  But I don't get over this way often I had to have my Rooster Chooster as I call it.  It's the bomb!  Doing chicken and dumplings first time.  Squash casserole always a go to for me.  Cornbread  is so good.  Love it!!!  I'll always love the Rooster Chooster!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

uU0FqE0_J_G3OMQSeO941w.text: Yes, I have continued to give The Roasting Company, year after year, a try because of the talk and good reviews. However, unfortunately I do not get it. From the service to the food, everything is a let down in my mind. Last night, almost a year after my last review, I decided to try them again for their so called "great" chicken and dumplings. Okay, if you like mushy dumplings with no flavor this dish is for you. Blah, wouldn't order again. It comes with one side and cornbread. Cornbread was hard as a rock and cold, ugh! However I will say the mixed veggies were pretty good. But, honestly, how badly can you mess up stir frying veggies?  So, with this final review I am going to pass on this place, too many great restaurants out there with some of the same food options.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken &amp; Dumplings with Mixed Vegetables and Cornbread.
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Baked Beans, still steaming!
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken &amp; Rice w/ Mac &amp; Cheese and Corn

et81micNUPwGCGuJ-w_VfA.text: RoCo as the locals call it offers some delicious roasted chicken and other Southern specialties.  The day my coworkers and I visited was chicken pot pie day.  Naturally, we opted for the special and it was definitely delicious.  It is piping hot, so use caution when eating.  Nice large chunks of chicken breast, peas, carrots, and potatoes are baked into a medium sized aluminum take out container with a crispy crust topping everything. Super delicious, especially, with their habanero hot sauce.  Will return to try their roast chicken next time!

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pot pie
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pot pie
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

crk19bGaaqBp3ITlMi1_xw.text: Went here twice now & still don't know what the hype is all about - why is this rated 4 stars? I had the chicken salad - it's deconstructed btw. Not a fan of that but I can combine the ingredients myself so oookkkk. But the chicken on top was bland & my family agreed. The place has a cool no-frills vibe but I'd rather have good food than atmosphere and was disappointed. Not going back. Don't recommend.

IBxztqqfYOO3p9URAUGFLw.text: Tried to dine here last evening, was drinking a beer with my boyfriend and saw a large cockroach running across the room so we immediately left. The place looks dirty and grungy for sure. Maybe Health Department needs to visit to see if there is an infestation going on.

YjJz_scxd1z8QlDIEFXKow.text: Disappointed! I was running errands & thought a bowl of chili from the Roasting Company would be great. It was pouring rain as I made my way in. The rating was at a 90.0... that sucks... need to work on that. Then I stood there waiting to place my order while the staff chatted it up behind the counter. It wasn't until one employee came out from behind & called to her coworker - several times- before she stopped talking to take my order. It was after 2pm so they were not busy. I placed my order to go & then proceeded to wait on my to-go order. After 10 minutes I got my food & I was on my way. Got home - order was wrong. This is not the first time this has happened with our to-go orders from the Roasting Company, but it will be the last for me. I'm officially DONE with the Roasting Company after 30 years.

3oR3TltI_E6KTh_01xSXgg.text: Roasting Company is a great spot for a casual atmosphere. We go almost weekly and find the service to be great. We usually sit at the bar where you can eat without going to the counter to order. The rotisserie chicken is always tasty, along with the assortment of sides. It's also very reasonable, price wise.

axxAPE376i6BX70OdCVTyg.text: I had the 1/2 chicken with Mac & cheese along with potatoes and it was pretty good. It sparked my interest enough that I'll definitely be back.

sBaqA-1z7k919bDYBU-TaA.text: The food is good, I've never had an issue with the food.  My issue for years has been the employees on Montford, just as it was again today :-(  Smiles and manners are free, maybe try using them.

Xo_Mx13z8L53hhXRnjzpIQ.text: As Bill O'Reilly would say, "F it, We'll do it live!" I'm writing this one while still here waiting on my Baked Apples to cool down.  Restaurant decor is very impressive (although the booths need to be reupholstered) and probably the most standout storefront on Montford. Walk in and the bar is the centerpiece, with a highlight on local brews. Smoke is in the air from the roasters as soon as you walk in and that's a good sign!  First time here so I tried the Thursday special: Chicken & Dumplings, along with Smoked Cheese & Pasta Salad, and Baked Cinnamon Apples.  Took a seat and my food was quick to arrive. Chicken & Dumplings were good. Nice flavor on the thickened broth but it was overpowered by a mountain of coarse black pepper. I don't say that lightly because I tend to go heavy on black pepper myself, but this was very overseasoned. I couldn't pick out the more subtle flavors in the dish due to the pepper. Dumplings were nice and fluffy, I'm used to a bit more al dente for dumplings but these were fine all the same.  Smoked cheese & pasta salad, best thing I had. The pasta was perfect, dressing was light and bright, seasoned with dill and cucumber. I could eat this everyday. The only thing I didn't pick up much of was smoked cheese, or much of any cheese, but I would take it the same way again and again.  Baked apples... Would have been better as applesauce. The apples were dissolving by just trying to pick them up with my spoon. Unfortunately cooking them to this point, this dish has also lost a lot of its subtle notes like the dumplings. I just got tart and over sweet. Bit of a disappointment.  Regardless of the apples, with good chicken and great pasta salad I'm looking forward to my next visit. I'll probably try the Cornbread dressing as the little round of Cornbread I got was killer! Lots of potential I see here, I just gotta find the right things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. This place fills up fast! 11:30 vs Noon.
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bottle cap art!
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken &amp; Dumplings, Smoked Cheese &amp; Pasta Salad, Baked Cinnamon Apples, and a little Cornbread round.

irWWUIdxzVJ7rb9hG1-o4g.text: This place is very much worth the drive. I had half white  Rotisserie I have 3 sides with it season corn collard greens and squash casserole. This food was so good it's all organic and they have some interesting sauces at the table try the tico sauce. The tico sauce with the chicken was excellent. And I must say the price is very fair they even offer a for side dishes platter before 5 dollars and 49 cents you can't beat that. I will be coming back here to eat again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1 half white rotisserie dinner with squash casserole season corn and collard greens

9SnwD3QCieqcuKCTX1QhZw.text: One of my fave places in Charlotte! My parents have been eating here since it opened and i've known about it forever. I always love taking people who have never been there bc they are always so pleased with how awesome the food is! Just a few of my favorite things! Smoked Cheese and Pasta (pasta salad) - It's my absolute favorite!!! I cant come here and not order that. It's tangy, creamy, and just awesome. The Wings - Order them traditional and get them with extra sauce... who doesnt like extra sauce? For dunking, pouring, taking shots...whatever...it's delicious. Chicken and Queso over Rice - AMAZING. And get jalapenos added to the top. Tico Sauce - this stuff is the bomb.com! Vinegary, Tangy, a little Spicy... and perfect for everything they have. Put it on your chicken with queso.. put it on your salad. Ordered tacos? Put it on that too. Also, if you crave it all the time like i do, just buy a bottle and take it home!!! Yummmmmm The summary of this review would be - JUST GO EAT THERE NOW. :) You wont be sorry. And they totally have a bar now - so drink up!

GQwzpYmGPV4eZKBOw_7U0Q.text: Every Time I eat here I get the Exact same Thing and I always think they will not have it anymore or I will not be able to remember what is is called nor how to order!  The Staff here is probably Cousin to Vavid and very helpful!  Pork BBQ Wrap, Minus the Rice, Minus the Cole Slaw, Minus the Cheese and Extra Sauce called well I'm not going to mis-spell that on yelp, nor say it, though it is good!  Collards on the Side please!

3XaPwid56DBYDoUFnPbFLQ.text: Not your typical sit-down kind of restaurant.  You stand in line (lines can get LONG at lunch), give your order to the cashier and then pick up your meal when they yell out your name.  The staff shuffles an enormous amount of clientele through the place at lunch (dinner is substantially slower) but is helpful when needed and remembers the regulars.    It's possibly my favorite lunchtime destination EVER.  I am currently a vegetarian but I've been eating here since my carnivore years.  (The chicken and black bean combo was excellent!)  My go-to order is the vegetarian combo, a mixture of rice, black beans, Jaco sauce (can only be explained as a cross between barbecue sauce and soy sauce...but that doesn't really work because, trust me, I've tried to recreate it at home!), cheese and chopped onions.  I always get the smoked gouda pasta salad...although there is no way that could be consTrued as good for me.  It's Nirvana on a plate!  All of the vegetables are delicious...daily specials disappear quickly!

UOJ38vmvEkxuaw53VTineA.text: This was pretty great. I had the chicken and queso with beans and rice. Its was perfect comfort food. I would absolutely eat here again. The garlic potatoes were also delicious.

sDvkUkOgBZqwD17kc8xzRQ.text: I went their recently and was very  disappointed.  I ordered the 1/2 portion dark chicken it had little  flavor. The card greens were bland , forgot the tico sauce which was much needed. Baked beans were dry .I could understand if they were busy ,but they had few customers at the time.  This used to be one of my favorites places to eat . The cornbread was excellent.  Will try them again at a later date.

E82x-mU99g_DwVSRdaidTg.text: The Roasting Company has been added to my official lunch list.  Walk in, grab a menu, walk up to the counter (or bar), order your food and grab a seat.  Your name will be called a few minutes later and you can go pick up your delicious chicken.    I need to go back so that I can try all of the other delicious foods.

dLO7odlkoMYp6zZd_W6fWw.text: This place has been a staple in south Charlotte for somewhere close to 15 years now, and they're still kickin'.   Rotisserie style chicken (moist and fresh, and seasoned perfectly) meets a kinda southwestern meets southern comfort food equals deliciousness. They offer a few rice and black bean plates, with or without queso. Also offered are a variety of vegetable side items, with daily specials- my favorite being the squash casserole. The collard greens are great too, as well as the smoked cheese and pasta salad.  Regardless of whAt you get, the portions are always generous and I find myself with leftovers for either a snack or dinner.   Check out the jaco and tico sauces. They also have a salsa bar inside.

kwp14hNr3VSTv1Gdl2lBqQ.text: Favorite place in the area. Living legend. The southern BBQ wrap is actually phenomenal and it had a great bar. Also serves food late.would highly recommend it.

u82AU4NK1Z-lKSdt6XyrNw.text: Based on the friend who took me to lunch here, as well as the full parking lot, I was expecting this place to be the best thing on earth.  Overall I can't complain.  The food was good.  They give you real plates and silverware, but yet it still feels casual and fun.  The prices were fair.  However, I was not blown away.  I got the 1/2 chicken with sweet potato fries,  The chicken had good flavor, but was a little tough and I could see this being replicated at most any casual dining place.  The fries were average and lacked that "something" that makes sweet potato fries different than regular fries.  The best thing on the plate was the cornbread - a real star here.    One thing I really liked was the high backed booths, which made you feel like you were the only people in the restaurant, even when full.  Even with this, though, the acoustics were of such where it was hard to have a conversation, and the music was a bit loud.    I really want to come back and try some of their more "tex mex" type dishes.  My friend works near this place, so I feel this is a reason why he has grown to appreciate it more.  It is good, but not worth going out of the way for.

-uUfC2ej19obNN_SCpJoGQ.text: Wow this place is excellent! New to the area and checked this place out recently. People in the other reviews aren't kidding about their sauce and the squash casserole!

ECtFZneiVnxv6LmahOzETw.text: Hidden gem on Montford dr. near Park Rd. Shopping Center. The Chicken is great, the sides are fantastic, the queso dip is the best I have had !

D79HPMyVJ3H2SlBEfHpUAA.text: It so disappointing when a great place goes under new management and everything people love about it changes. When I heard Jake wasn't there anymore I couldn't believe it. Perhaps it's all coincidence or the new manager has something to do with it. But by the looks of it they have taken a hit in business, go figure since the atmosphere has completely changed. This place also seems less friendly to Montford, they now only do food until 1:30, and close at 12 Sun-Wed. They only offer  a limited menu after 10, and they no longer provide table service. Drink specials seem to have stayed the same but for all you beer lovers, the draft lineup is never switched up anymore, huge downfall. My husband and I were maybe not frequent enough to call regulars but were in there at least 3 times per month (enough as to where Jake and Danielle knew us by name). It was a little treat to go to The Roasting Co., get a drink and dinner, get recommendations on places in Charlote with good food. Now we like to go to Moosehead down the street. Also, they are lucky ALE hasn't hit them yet considering the new manager drinks at the bar out in the open during work (very unprofessional). We'll be getting all togo from here on out.

IpW1C6nRkUpdfEAG45ZQWg.text: I am astonished! When in walked up I thought this experience would be boring but quite the opposite.     My taste budswere thrown for a loop! What the heck is in the squash casserole? Delicious! And how about their own "Tico Sauce" made and sold right here on location.  A very interesting blend of spices inspired by Costa Rica.  Very nice!  I shall be Back!

dIvHEUVPDviDb-E104BbAA.text: The roasting company is a great spot on Montford.  You go up to the food counter and place your order and pretty quickly they are calling your name to pick up your food. The rotisserie chicken is on point and the sides that you get with it are awesome.  I am usually not a fan of vegetables but you must try the white bean au gratin and the squash casserole.

l86ghe4pdJRiNgX6woTZfQ.text: I've been going here since I was in high school. The food itself is the best in Charlotte for a proverbial hole in the wall restaurant. Food taste great, it's reasonably priced, and you get it quickly. If you're newcomer I would recommend either the Monterey chicken wrap or the Jaco pork wrap. The best sides are smoked pasta salad, mashed sweet potatoes, or any of the casseroles.  Would help to have the dining room tables cleared quicker and the tables need to be cleaner.

sx-m-gUp7DVWRmUysm2OhQ.text: I'm not sure how I haven't reviewed this place before now!! Seriously I eat here like twice a month haha. Can we say rotisserie chicken heaven!! Everything I've had here is great but honestly my favoritist thing is the squash casserole!! Seriously if you get a veggie plate you will feel like you've been transported to a southern Sunday church social!! I feel like they have the little old southern ladies cooking in the back!! Anyways their chicken is good, occasionally dry but I don't mind my chicken that way really. Their chicken pot pies are good and absolutely huge for the money. However the crust is a crisco crust I believe and that's not my favorite. I also recently tried the Jaco pork and it was amazing. My favorite things though are the veggies (haven't I said that already lol). If I get the quarter chicken or the veggie plate I kind of feel like it's Thanksgiving because there is squash casserole, sweet potato mash, green beans, mac and cheese if it's Saturday etc. If you order it through foodie call it's the one and only restaurant that your food will arrive 100% still piping hot!!   If I'm craving comfort food and I don't want to cook this is my go to restaurant!

fgHrcw9hV64FPe6GClN4lg.text: I was so disappointed. The sides tasted liked they came out of a can, and I bought better roasted chicken at the grocery store. The sweet mashed potatoes looked absolutely DISGUSTING. They were GRAY! Also, they ran out of their special. It was 2 p.m. How could you possibly run out of the special at 2 pm?? I don't recommend this place and I will never go back. It was gross.

VL0gJpNLhf_PT8OzyMQvAg.text: I've been loving the Roasting Company since I would tag along with my parents and eat there as a kid. Carribean music and vibe, good beer specials, and really delicious chicken.   I always go for the 1/4th white meal, but I've had the dark and it's delicious also. The chicken and rice con queso, monterey chicken wrap and chicken and black bean combo are also awesome choices. Go for the tico black beans, garlicky new potatoes, collard greens or cinnamon apples for sides - the stir fry veggies and white bean au gratin are a little bland compared to the rest of the selections. If you happen to come in when the mac and cheese or stewed okra and tomatoes are on special, definitely try those out as well.  The cashiers at the counter are always friendly and I've never left this place hungry. Perfect.

Jzyl0Mzsfj-ZeKL_JCScsw.text: I've had the authentic Costa Rican rice, beans, and chicken in Jaco Beach.  The roasting company's version is tastier! Their basic plates of rice, beans, chicken or pork, and two sides is a really great deal for the price.  I ate here a year ago and don't remember being impressed, but decided to try it again and this time it really hit the spot.  The black beans and white bean au gratin were perfectly seasoned and yummy.  The green beans were too watery  but still not bad.  The Pork with Jaco sauce was delish.  I will be eating here much more often.

DWiVt9wC2CDX4gbbq1St-Q.text: My favorite thing to get at the Roasting Company ...by far ...is their Chicken Pot Pie, they only make it on Wednesdays, and you might want to call in and order yours before noon, because they tend to run out pretty quick.  The chicken pot pie is amazing.  The crust is moist doughy and flaky with a unique spice flavor, and the chicken is tender and delicious.  I have had their wings as well as some regular orders of the chicken and all of those things are decent, but the one thing you must get here is the Chicken Pot Pie.

9aY2QWkhDPDdph4zBM0B2A.text: On my first visit I had the roasted chicken, which was flavorful and moist.  The chicken pot pies are by far the best I ever had and are consistent every time...they have mastered this dish.  They are so good that I have not tried anything else on the menu since the Wednesday following my first visit.  The serving is huge and packed with flavor!!!  The crust is delicious and holds up perfectly (never soggy or wet, even when reheated after being refridgerated overnight).  In my book, they are fully deserving of a permanent spot on the menu rather than just on Wednesdays.

tUupXrZAKejtP-JS599dUQ.text: Yum, yum, yum!  I wasn't even sure this place was open when I drove by it the first 1000 times but we finally decided to go in and give it a shot while getting the oil changed down the street.  Well worth it!  I had the rotisserie chicken sandwich and it was a MOUND of chicken with thier special jaco sauce on a bun with lettuce and tomato.  Definitely plenty...I couldn't eat it all.  The jaco sauce...which I was told contained soy, pineapple juice, honey, and worchestire sauce....tasted more like watered down soy all by itself.  It was so salty!  For my side, I had cheese grits and they were creamy, delicious, and a little spicy thanks to what I think were some green chiles.  All in all, good stuff, but next time, I will get the sauce on the side.  Oh!  For vegetarians, this is a dream....they have at least 10 veggies on their side menu, plus specials of the day.  Veggie plates all around!

6SOMPawCbdrKIil3rlrm_A.text: When I lived nearby, I would eat here at least once a week.  You can't go wrong here.  The menu is centered on roasted chicken.   You can get it with Jaco sauce, black beans, whole chicken etc.  They have a large variety of sides that are just as good as the entrees.  It is a very fast-order at the counter type of place.  It is cheap, filling, and very tasty.

jRkCGj2luHjJujkYMjsS8w.text: After the great reviews I expected something... good. Instead I was completely underwhelmed. So-so to gross ingredients, edible but barely. Will not be going back here.

JfFOLdVVyTv39MdeF3-2mg.text: Great place and super cheap.  I usually get a side item plate...they have so many great ones to choose from (squash casserole, smoked cheese and pasta, basil green beans, mashed sweet potatoes...)  You can also get rotisserie chicken...just be sure to use the Tico sauce on the table.  Great!!

d330YVwzjHQvjj2xLPGJYg.text: I've only been here twice, once years ago and then again this past weekend.  We recently moved closer to this area an am sure we will visit often.  At least whenever we need a veggie fix.  Known for their roasted chicken, we both ordered it with different veggies.  The pasta salad was very unique and tasty.  Collards and mac & cheese did not disappoint.  They have changed the place a good bit since I was last here, adding a bar.  The bar was beautiful and a place I wouldn't mind hanging out with friends.  A lot of people passed us with wings, maybe something we'll try next.  It isn't a huge place but there is a good bit of seating still.  You walk up an order then pickup when they call you.  Makes for a quick lunch or dinner.  Enjoy!

GPdF1bymWnKfDecwWF4kFA.text: Great place!  I liked it 10 years ago and I love it now.  Food has always been great and now the bar makes it a Charlotte staple.  Pretty much the only place I go.

rY8wZtKeAMp4EIDEYkaGYg.text: A first time visit but definitely not the last.  I ordered the roasted chicken & black beans con queso and was more than pleased with the flavor and portion.  The bartender, Eli, was attentive and his suggestion to try the squash casserole was spot on.   If you are seeking a relaxed atmosphere & great food, check out The Roasting Company.

1g9HJzgcOdVlkAAa8oQhfw.text: We tried RoCo tonight for the first time and it was fine. We live on the other side of town and I wouldn't make a special trip just to visit here. The positive is that we had dinner for 2 and a OMB Copper for $23.75, the stir fry veggies and the corn bread. I love veggies but the green beans had a flavor to them that I didn't care for. My husband enjoyed the garlic roasted potatoes. I sampled his and will say that they are VERY VERY garlicky. He had the chicken and rice and liked it well enough. I had the quarter white meat. I guess with all the fantastic reviews, my expectations were a little too high. I didn't feel like it had any different flavor than a Costco rotisserie chicken that I can buy for $4.99. I just wasn't feeling it.

VljG_ye9A-zcZellTrougw.text: Viva The Roasting Company!  This place has a great Costa Rica chicken rotisserie style food. It's also located in the heart of the ever popular Montford Drive. And there is even a private parking lot for this place - imagine that!    The food is mainly chicken, and I usually go for the quarter white meal which comes with two of their great sides. Try the cinnamon apples as one of them - you won't be disappointed. And it's like having dessert. I also recently tried their chicken salad sandwich and thought the chicken salad itself was done really really well. Oh and Wednesday's are chicken pot pie days - rather large ones too.
