Inside the place has been remodeled and expanded. They now have a large bar which makes for a great evening scene and will keep them in business even longer. I prefer to sit in one of the tall booths. They make you feel like you and your compadres are dining in a private room. There are also some swanky high top tables as well.  So if you are a carnivore, go check out this great chicken restaurant!

vBoKpGDKxZcmLoq6nBpB4g.text: Finally made it here for lunch after hearing good things and living near by for years. I was especially excited to try the Costa Rican inspired food after visiting the country earlier this year and completely falling in love with the food and culture. Unfortunately I didn't care for the food at all. I wouldn't say it was necessarily bad but just didn't suit my taste. I had the chicken and black bean plate with sauteed vegetables. I found everything overly salty and didn't like the sauce at all. I'm not a picky eater and like most foods (except turnip greens, I just can't sorry) but I didn't enjoy this meal. My husband ordered a wrap with chicken, black beans and queso that he said was just "okay." It was chicken pot pie day when we were that and that did look good and like a popular choice. We probably won't be back but it's a place everyone might need to try for themselves. Fortunately the prices are reasonable enough to do just that.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

rS0ggt9F7UBAfO3HdsMSug.text: Chicken was very tender, nice size pieces, collards and apples were tasty as well. Only giving 4 stars as they should have their own signature sauce! Will absolutely be back.

YbrBvbUdxwuayCjJh8T4Zw.text: This place was great! The food (roasted half chicken and chicken wrap were our entrees) is amazing. My wrap was larger than q large burrito. The atmosphere was a dive and really cool. Food is served on real plates with real silverware and the food is cooked with special care. The 2 of us are for $22. You will not fi D a better bargain.

lweUIpdp8zgWipMeiKtltQ.text: Great selection of local brews. Food was fast and delicious. Atmosphere was casual, comfortable, and classy. All around perfection!

5bUNGqE-90hAPEEz9mu4Qw.text: The Roasting Company has to be one of my favorite spots to grab some fresh southern food with a bit of a Tex mex twist. Their garlicky new potatoes are mouth watering when paired with their basil green beans. Their location on Montfort Dr is super convenient but be sure to park around back as it's typically pretty full. The best part is they're open late which is perfect whether you're eating in or taking it to go.

gyl2_DaMlb3EdkguWVelNA.text: My first 5-star rating... I left this place saying to myself "This is where I will take people when they want good food."   That's got to be the highest honor in the restaurant business, right?   Ordering food is quick and easy - walk up to the counter, menus are there but just ask the staff what they like the best. Always will give you something new to try. Always comes out good.  I get the Chicken Queso on Rice. Unbelievably good! Shredded chicken over rice covered in queso. The Mac & Cheese is spicy and different - the baked beans also have a kick. The cornbread actually has corn in the bread and sweet tea rounds off the southern experience.  If you drive too quickly down Montford you'll miss this gem... So slow down and enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Queso w/ Rice.... a.k.a Heaven on a plate

aFyaJQ4WLZWFx3A7TRrI5A.text: Wowie Zowie!!  This place is awesome. I've eaten here for lunch and dinner before, and I would do it again.   The Jaco Pork and rice is awesome. It might be better than the chicken, but they're both great. If you get the. Chicken and rice with queso, put some Tico sauce on there!  The sides that I've had were great. The smoked cheese and pasta (it's a pasta salad) was really tasty, and I usually don't like pasta salad. Cornbread was great too.

Wqo2GXu58AkMgvk1JKDPig.text: The chicken is good and the sides are always delicious. There's a bar that tends to serve a good variety of beers and stays open late.

l-CN1he4csYqzjAA9AUxrQ.text: The Roasting Company's most endearing thing to me (being that I am a night shifter) is the late hours all week. On several occasions my boyfriend and I have gone late at night when we're finally ready to eat or have had late work meetings and can't grab dinner until 1030. With that being said, every time I have been in it is super chill with a small (and mostly quiet) group of people inside. There are plenty of beer options, we always sit at the bar since it's always late, and have never had any problems with service. The portions are huge for what you pay, you won't leave hungry. The food is good, you're not going for five star here, but it is always cooked properly and hits the mark for its cuisine category. I do love the cornbread, it actually has pieces of corn in it, and I normally am not a fan of cornbread. My partner and I at work even grabbed dinner at 1AM the other day, being we work on an ambulance, they were extremely quick to prepare our food--We were very grateful!! Good spot for a casual late night when you're starving and not looking to be fancy.

qYfiFMc0MllPRJW9rh7sGg.text: Best meal. Great chicken, great veggies. Cheap. I came in hungry and left full with leftovers.... And only payed $9 Cool bar and good beer selection.

GWz1vFSj8W0ig0Cc38JPnA.text: When I lived in Charlotte I use to eat here at least once a week as this was near my office.  The interior restaurant has changed in the last couple of years which was a much needed renovation.  Tip:  Thursday - do your self a favor and get the chicken and dumplings!  You can't go wrong with that choice.  It is heaven in a LARGE cup!  Prices have gone up but still well worth the value.  Their chicken is ALWAYS fresh and there are so many different variations.  They now have a bar area if you have a moment to grab some however I never have since I have been on business on every trip.  This is mostly a self service including drinks.  You order, pickup when your name is called and sit and enjoy the food that melts in your mouth.  I am and will be a fan for years to come anytime I make it back to CLT

SmMOQhyeHdcSQVjVHzekuw.text: The service was ok, we had some really rude service staff and at the same time some really nice service at the end. I had the black bean taco, it barely had any flavor. It was basically a tortilla and beans, nothing special and the ratio was definitely off. I would not recommend. However my husband got the bbq taco and he said they were really good. Overall mediocre.

YxOrMUponho_MsZFJ5gTIw.text: Not a typical rotisserie.  I was expecting some else before walking into the Roasting Company, but I was pleasantly surprised in my findings.    Two options for ordering when we went their for lunch.  Either order at the standard chowline formation, or you can place a order at the bar too.    This would be a great place for group outings as people can order and pay separately with ease.  I got the chicken wrap and it was delicious.  FYI it was more of burrito than a wrap. Also, you should make sure to try the Costa Rica sauce that is offer by the salsa bar.

k9dGpusBln1_5CUhIohDQA.text: Very good and very consistent!!! Sides have no meat unless specified, which is great for Vegetarians, or ppl who just want to know what they are putting in their mouths.  Their roasted chicken is awesome and they are generous.   This is a quick place to eat and casual. You place your order, grab food when your names called, etc.   I haven't sampled the bar, yet- but there's always hope. Lol. Looks good.   Also, this place offers service with a smile and a large variety of sides! Huge meal, veggie plate or sandwich/wrap combo. No fries, but you won't miss them.    The only thing if any, that I'd change would be, a dessert or two, but even then, they offer a few daily, until gone. All good. You will get your money's worth and a full tummy!

WgSTF23Pn8-RgYz45VUe4w.text: The Roasting Company was our go-to spot when we lived in the neighborhood. It was quick and always delicious. We would often dine in and even more often grab it to go.  Our favorite dishes are the pork over rice and the 1/4 chicken with 2 sides. The sauces are unique and so good! I always get the squash casserole as a side and alternate between the others. I've never been disappointed but some other favorites are the garlic roast potatoes, the pasta salad, the mac n cheese, the baked beans....you get the idea.   I love that I can eat healthy here. Just get some roast chicken and a couple of veggie sides.   We will miss having this place nearby but we'll be back.

_pU0L6ZY0L2Lcl5Xvr88zg.text: This is my favorite place in the area.  It's my go to on the week days, weekend, and for my birthday.    Friendly faces, late night food, the daily specials - ALWAYS worth eating.  Don't forget the sides, they're all to die for.    Favorites:  Chicken Pot Pie, Cheesy Grits, Cornbread and Chili Tacos.  So much space, good for big parties, and if the line looks long, it goes quick.  LASTLY - get all the wings, taste them all.  They take longer, but only because they are delish.

MhhnBLgUk7Db7c33lGHpsA.text: Delicious local delicacy. Great spot on Montford for a quick bite or a lazy afternoon. Awesome - easy to spot- selection of gluten-free options. Full bar. Nice patio. One of my favorites!

Hyi-nyth6S_1vBJlyMcFIQ.text: Just good chicken! Counter ordering eliminates the waitstaff and makes this a quick dining option. The greens were very vinegary but I kind of liked them. Great choice for lunch.

vwT99MLCGh_MUugfX7HdYw.text: Need to come here more often,  excellent rotisserie chicken, juicy and hot with awesome sides.  Dill potato salad is super creamy and baked beans are saucy with a hint of green pepper are my favorite ones, plenty more and some daily options.  Nice bar, this visit is way over due for a great eatery on a street with options, this is one of the best.  Cornbread muffins, you need more than one.

SPID3w9CqVakfJktQkcAbA.text: First time to this little gem, Great Roasted Chicken and the sides!! Wow ! The sides are amazing, never have I seen so  many great choices...from Squash Casserole to Pasta with Provelone to Seasoned Corn. the Selection goes on and on and also adds different ones during the week. I wanted to try just the Chicken and 2 sides. It was great..not a tiny chicken like you get at some places but a nice sized breast and wing, thigh and leg combo. Very Juicy and warm.  Their Barbecue sauce is delicious..a step away from the norm - I think it must have coffee in it...Wonderful!.  A couple of salsas top off the additions to make your roast chicken more tasty!  I will be coming back...I would even do the 4 sides and cornbread next time..I wanted to taste all the veggie!!!

hj_Nc5VToJUm2_pwvTKWXg.text: We went there for lunch after reading the Yelp reviews and having to be in Charlotte on business. The first thing I'll say is that the parking is easy and that is always a plus when you are going somewhere you've never been. The restaurant is one in which you  pay and order at the register and then you wait and they call your name and you take your food to a table. Most of us order the 1/4 chicken, which came with corn bread and a side. This was the perfect size meal for lunch and is priced appropriately. Our orders came out quickly and we took a great table by the windows. The food was delicious. The staff is very pleasant and hard working. I will certainly return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

bBZtKcPFr1iEE1pc-K_Eag.text: One of my favorite places in Charlotte, a must-try.  My personal is the chicken con queso which is just rice, chicken, and queso and sometimes I get black beans and sometimes not just depends on the mood.  My two favorite sides are the squash casserole and baked cinnamon apples I've been wanting to try the mac and cheese that's a special on Saturday but I did not get there early enough. Very, very good cornbread.  All of my friends love this place, they have really good wings as well as the chicken wrap are among some crowd favorites but you really can't go wrong here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken con Queso with Squash Casserole and Baked Cinnamon Apples and Cornbread. Love this place.

vFL1-WW5brq81__4JjGFKw.text: If it were possible to give less than one star I would. My husband and I ordered the Jacko pork with rice and sides. The pork was bland and the portion was less than a kid's portion. The veggies were also bland. I will never patronize this restaurant again. It is extremely disappointing to pay for food and get so little. I don't understand why this restaurant has a four star rating. The food is mediocre at best, I'm being kind.

0s5GvT95NVBGgpGq2nPF_w.text: My favorite chicken place in Charlotte since the early '90s. EVERYTHING is great and the Jaco sauce is the bomb. Chicken and black bean combo is my all time fav.

4lCYKt3CBA9NNvBBqV_rpg.text: This is what I imagine prison food to taste like. We ordered two different chicken plates with various sides. Everything we ordered was watery and tasted like mystery mush. Even the stir fry veggies were bad-- how do you mess that up?  On the plus side, everything was timely and service was very nice.

PMASAqrn4-2TrLyYzFGZ7Q.text: The half chicken with all dark meat is the way to go. The chicken was moist and the cornbread was filling. I went with three sides instead of two and thought it was just the right amount of food for a post workout meal.

GRmoqSj4PwJB5LGmjMrbDA.text: I thought this place was excellent quality for the price.  The chicken was delicious and I loved the amazing selection of side items.  The sweet mashed potatoes were great as well as the roasted veggies.  Overall I will be back a lot more now that I know it's here.  Plus it's totally Paleo

_qXvx0qrIBgdYHWtJKyVSA.text: A co-worker picked this place and boy am I gald she did.  I ordered the evil wings and the roasted vegetables.  My co-worker got the roasted chicken.  All the food was very good.  I also got a side of the Nuclear sauce.  Wow was that good!  I will get the nuclear wings next trip even though the evil sauce was really good too.  The best thing about the evil sauce is that its different.

18nTZNpQfCYQBp4sXOxqvg.text: I had the chili tacos, while they were good they didn't really offer a variety of toppings sour cream etc. the restaurant was clean, didn't like that they didn't have servers, but I understand it. Overall I was extremely satisfied with my lunch and so we're my coworkers. I couldn't tell which was the men's and which was the women's restroom, the M and W were hard to see. I would definitely go back.

je_iSYXS1NWXfm9Cm9VrpA.text: This place reminds me of a place back in NY..!!  Their rotisserie chicken is PHENOMENAL! Always fresh, always hot!  I came her on a lazy Friday night after work...it was one of those nights where I didn't really want to go out to dinner, but I didn't really want to stay home...when I first walked in it took me a sec to figure out their set up, and how it works, so I just followed the crowd... (Btw, Don't let the exterior look of this place scare you away-it can look a bit "outdated/older")  Once inside, You walk up to a counter, place your order/pay and then wait off to side until they call your name. You can place your order to go, or you can look for a an open table.  I saw that there was two open seats at the bar so I told the young lady that I would be by the bar. I was waiting to here my name be called...but she brought the food on over to me, which was extremely nice of her since she didn't have to do that.   One of the reasons I decided to actually stay and eat there was that all there draft beer is $3.50 on Fridays. You CANT beat that. They have an AWESOME selection of beers...I just had to stay lol...  We ordered: Chicken and black bean combo con queso - rice topped with chicken, black beans and queso. It was delicious! The chicken was pulled right off of the bird, it was hot, tender. juicy....really really good.  1/2 rotisserie chicken dinner with sidesd. Again, the chicken was just PERFECT!  For sides we had white beans au gratin 3/5, squash casserole 5/5, smoked cheese and past salad 5/5, and the collard collard greens 4/5.  This place just reminds me of home. If you want a homestyle cooked meal, without making it yourself, this is the PERFECT place to come to.   I will definitely be coming back here again. I really enjoyed the food and had really great service.

Ft-U-E6CRxyrdlPxU-aEKA.text: Almost wish I didn't work Uptown because this is a great lunch spot. They have a surprisingly large menu including everything from rotisserie chicken plates to taco salads.  Order at the register and wait for your name. They have a large dining area and some porch seating. Perfect for groups or individuals. Super quick, inexpensive, and delicious.  As for the food, I enjoyed my meal but was underwhelmed with my choice. The chicken and rice con queso was good, but the rice was bland in my opinion. Disclaimer: not a big white rice lover. But the chicken and queso and cornbread were on point. Next time I'll go the rotisserie chicken plate route.  Eager to try this place again, just wish it was closer to me.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and rice con queso with pasta salad and cornbread

fIrLD3lKCyM_F6VRugfoGQ.text: Ordered at 7:25. By 7:50 still hadn't gotten food. Had to cancel. Didn't know they were 20 minutes behind until I had to cancel. No empathy or apology. Terrible service.

nyKqT7cYUKxtDvBlkM_1kQ.text: Date night with my sis at the bar.  Dinner and drinks on a Thursday evening.  Not packed, pleasant company from Jake the bartender and apparently a few locals who helped us pick our meals.  I went with the pork, which was very tasty.  My highlight was squash casserole.  Sooo good - I actually went home and attempted my own version which tasty, but not nearly as good.  Green beans could've used a bit more salt.  I ordered wings to go and they smelled heavenly, but my kids devoured them before I could try them and confirm if they're finger-licking.  I'll just assume yes.  I did not know they were hiding a salsa station around the corner (where I think the take out is?).  Yup, that's the icing on the cake!  Or in this case, the salsa on the everything :) Bathrooms were clean, music not too loud, full bar, local brews, service was on point.  Parking lot was full, but i easily found a spot on the street. Prices were fair and Ill be back for more of everything.

photos.caption: Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken n black bean combo w black bean salad n greens
Photo of The Roasting Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jack pork w rice, squash casserole n greens

Ve7VcsE1T6pyoJmRZdwppg.text: Okay so it was my friend's idea to go here. Honestly if I had checked it out online first I probably wouldn't have gone. In reality the food is lacking flavor. I mean, it's good but it could use some more flavors as far as seasoning the chicken. Seriously. I had the chicken salad sandwich and it was super bland in my mouth. Couldn't finish it. I also had mac and cheese which was okay but I was confused why they labeled it spicy when there was not a twinge of spicy lol. I tasted my friend's veggies, and they just weren't very flavorful. I guess if you are on a low sodium diet, or you just like plain food you should go here. I mean, I wanted to like it, but I couldn't get past the lack of seasoning. If you all are gonna do an arroz con pollo you need to add some flavor. (tasted that too). I need yall to spice up your life @theroastingcompany lol

X-XV2XjybNxG5EuW1oCv5Q.text: I'm not 100% sure what the hype is about. The Roasting Company kind of falls under the "comfort food" category for me, but I've certainly had better comfort food in Charlotte. Admittedly, I didn't actually order any chicken. My pulled pork was pretty bland, even with the Jaco sauce on it. I had a side of mac and cheese, which was on par with any other mac and cheese out there. The highlight of my meal was the collard greens - well seasoned and tender.   My group and I had a hard time finding a clean table. The restrooms were also a little dingy. I realize this is not an upscale establishment, but the place felt a bit grimy.   While my experience was fairly mediocre, I can definitely see this being a great place to get drunk food in the middle of the night.

pGG6-tAokuaQ3Zq5iMOtYQ.text: Jaco pork taco and white bean gratin are my favorite! Try the tico sauce too!! Yummy!!

250hcmqnyNo79B9J6Hcmrw.text: WOW! The wife ordered the chicken and black bean combo con queso and I got the sante fe chili and rice. We also ordered and split 10 hot wings. The chicken and black bean combo con queso is boneless, skinless rotisserie chicken served over our herb rice and topped with queso which I have to say after tasting it my wife threatened to stab me with her fork if I tried to get anymore. The sante fe chili and rice was homemade beef chili served over rice and topped with our queso sauce. Man this stuff was stick to your ribs goodness. The wings were the type we loved which had a crispness to them and the sauce was divine. They have other sauces there to try which are also very yummy. We had a wonderful time there and will most definitely be back.

b2b5jrPvF4R_G67Dr01r2Q.text: They roast chicken....we get to enjoy!  Other than the oddly-placed meatloaf special on Fridays, this place is all about the yard bird; although the meatloaf is pretty killer.  This place has the best chicken pot pie I have ever had....good luck finishing it.....

HTNodtVV7NyY5bz-UTESBg.text: A solid 5/5. Phenomenal food in a laid back atmosphere, order at the counter and pick up food when your name is called. The rotisserie chicken is among the best I've ever had and the homemade veggie sides are all great, especially the cinnamon apples and squash casserole. It's hard to go wrong here!

APUI12_OuWg_6XLV8lbzsw.text: I will preface the next few reviews by saying that North Carolina has some of the best food I've ever had. I've been to the state four times over the past six years, and every time I come, I am blown away by the food.  Roasting Company is yet another place that serves great food for great prices. The chicken is tender, the sides are delicious, the atmosphere is cool, and the prices are very good. I got the soft tacos, spicy mac 'n cheese, and chili. The tacos are made with the rotisserie chicken, though they didn't use the most tender and juicy meat that I love. However, the lettuce and cheese were very fresh, as was the tortilla, and the sauce selection is pretty good. The spicy mac 'n cheese was a special vegetable of the day (I love any state that calls mac 'n cheese a vegetable) so it might not be available every day, but it was damn good; creamy, tasty mac 'n cheese with a real kick. The chili was fantastic; homemade from an old recipe, just the right amount of everything, and a good helping of shredded cheddar and sour cream on top. All that for about $8. If you're ever in Charlotte, definitely check this place out.

gF26kaSPH8mcWO0MzMi0cA.text: This is a nice place to go for generous portions.  they serve roasted chicken (as to be expected for someplace named the roasting company!).  You can get tacos, some sandwiches and a dish called jaco pork (with rice).  There are side dishes, wraps and salads as well.  Prices are reasonable ~$8 for a plate and $6.50 or so for a sandwich.  The food is tasty, prepared to order (mostly) and arrives in minutes.  I have been for lunch and dinner and enjoyed every meal!

mZ4scvPGce6StufcMeCElg.text: Yum. Yum. Yum. From the delicious, fall-off-the-bone chicken, to the random chicken + something delicious + something else delicious combos, you can't go wrong with anything at The Roasting Company. The sides are all great, especially the spicy mac and cheese on Saturdays and the corn muffins that come with are scrumptious and have corn and green chilies in them. And while the food is always great, the service is always spectacular as well! Everyone who works there must be constantly eating the food because they are ALL so happy! Their to-go option is great too. Call it in and scoot directly to the front of the line to pick it up. And, while this might sound trivial, the food is packaged up well so you don't have any crazy spills on the way home.

iJSlftlkT01gQ78r2dfgyw.text: My favorite place to eat but the parking has become ridiculous!  People use the parking and then walk down the street.  I have left several times because of parking issue!

rUTM2qBx_a7IFwTjXSJTkQ.text: this place is really going down hill fast....been eating there since they opened and not only is the food now lacking but the service is just flat out bad. Called an order to go today and made 3 stops prior in about 30 minutes and still had to wait on my food. A few weeks ago they completely missed one of our dinners on a take-out order as well.  Such a shame

E7dPeu7a5Y-KHUYZEaXwMg.text: I wanted to like this place but there was just something about the meal I had that just was not right.  Maybe it was my fault to get the dish that had almost every ingredient in it.  I will certainly try them again and hope for the best.

ICvuckbTpXCDpzaCMOGleA.text: My coworker introduced me to the Roasting Company and I'm really glad about it. This place is awesome. It's great for a decent lunch or dinner. The food is tasty and the selection of sides is impressive. It's relatively cheap, as you will pay under $10 per meal/person. The workers are friendly and service is fast. Hooray for Roasting Company!!   :)

aBWLbd94mmuj64GoJqlkRg.text: Great chicken, be sure to ask for a side of the BBQ sauce (much better than the sauce on the table).  Sides are excellent - try the collard greens and sweet potatoes.  This is a takeout staple for me during the winnter months.

UXQVkwdrh5MJvO2d8ADEng.text: I was pleasantly surprised when I finally got over to the Roasting Company one day for lunch.  I had heard about it for years and my mom was always getting it for me when I was sick but I had never actually been inside.  She said the way they seasoned their chicken was perfect for getting over the common cold.  Well she was right, it always did the trick.  So I was thrilled when on a rather healthy-feeling day I went in for a delicious meal of fresh veggies and homemade cake!  The chicken, as always, hit the spot.  There was a cool, funky vibe in there thanks to the young and welcoming staff.  And it was nice to just order at the counter and then kick back in the casual environment and catch up with old friends.

W_U5p813IP0yWPhoCJfgPw.text: Great place for a quick and local lunch. The chicken is moist, juicy and tender. The half chicken is a fantastic deal, for the extra $2 you are rewarded with 50% more meat. The sauce counter is full of spicy surprises. Overall a great local lunch joint - the kind of place you will like introducing to your friends.

KJyP7K2pDlItO_wyifjSgA.text: The best place in Charlotte for a good, cheap, filling meal (especially to-go). You can't go wrong with the quarter chicken (white meat), two vegetables and the included corn bread. We pick up dinner here about once a week and both my wife and I can get more than enough for about $11 total.

nIDcupRZSerVBeiHnXblQA.text: Went after church today since it was just my wife and myself eating lunch.  Man, I love this place!  The flavors are great! I love the salsa bar with FRESH pico and salsas.  Sides are equally excellent.  Food is simple, but very good.   We ordered takeout, and had enough for lunch, and then leftovers for dinner!  Can't wait to go back!

sGbjViru0iJfxH5cBpMeHQ.text: First time there.  Got the Jaco salad which was awful.  Soaking in a pool of water, it had NO flavor whatsoever.  Tried topping it with salsa from the bar.  That was tasteless too!  Yikes.  Not worth a return visit for that, but I will try the chicken sometime since everyone here says it's so good.

A1uT8mx_S7719Oh2Dh41Mg.text: I've lived in Charlotte over a decade - I can't believe it either - and lived all over the city. The one constant is that I'll schlep from anywhere in the city to Montford for the Roasting Company.  For me, it's the Tico sauce, not so much the Jaco sauce. I have to have some Tico black beans with extra Tico at least once a week. I just keep forgetting to go on Fridays when they have stewed okra and tomatoes. Darnit!  And I agree with the other poster who mentioned just how many restaurants have come and gone on Montford over the years. The Roasting Company still remains.

VEU1NeGi1Utj55aLJ_HG8w.text: I can't get enough of this place for a quick lunch.  Plus, you can find many healthy options that taste great!  One of those rare places that I can leave satisfied and still feel good about myself for eating somewhat healthy.  Don't worry though, you can find your fair share of unhealthy things too!!

TUd3bPfdmWBlTlLnXg3JLg.text: This place has great food.  I love the chicken and black beans, but anything with their jaco sauce is great.  Their food has a little bit of a southwestern feel- they offer bbq, tacos, and have fabulous cornbread.  The only negative I have about this place is that most things come with side items, but the side items vary daily.  This is a great place for takeout.
